Steam (ST): It was already approaching 10:00 at night. By now, the typhoon had wrapped itself around Rokkenjima.
Umineko Project (UP): It was already approaching ten at night.{n}The typhoon had already engulfed Rokkenjima.
PC Japanese (JP): 時間は、もう夜の１０時を間近としている。すでに台風は六軒島を包み込んでいた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 時間は、もう夜の１０時を間近としている。{n}すでに台風は六軒島を包み込んでいた。
Russian (RU): Время вплотную приблизилось к 10 часам ночи.{n}К этому моменту тайфун уже полностью окружил Роккенджиму.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aproximava‐se das dez da noite.{n}O tufão já havia engolido Rokkenjima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 時間已臨近晚上十點。{n}台風早已包圍住了六軒島。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 时间已临近晚上十点。{n}台风早已包围住了六轩岛。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si stavano già facendo le 10:00 di notte. Ora come ora, il tifone avvolgeva Rokkenjima.

Steam (ST): Even the rose garden that had looked so beautiful midday... was beaten down upon by the fierce winds and resisted with all its might, undulating and trying to keep the flowers from blowing away...
Umineko Project (UP): Even the rose garden that had looked so beautiful during the day...was now being beaten down upon by the fierce winds and resisting with all its might, undulating and trying to keep the flowers from blowing away...
PC Japanese (JP): 昼間、あれだけの美しさを見せてくれた薔薇庭園も、今は暴風に耐え、その花を飛ばされまいとうねり、必死の抵抗を続けている…。
Russian (RU): Даже розарий, радовавший своей красотой глаз в середине дня, оказался изрядно потрепан яростными ветрами и сопротивлялся изо всех сил, не собираясь сдаваться, и старался не позволить ветру вырвать и унести прочь цветы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo o jardim de rosas que parecia tão belo durante o dia...agora estava sendo atacado pelos fervorosos ventos e resistindo a eles com todas as suas forças, ondulando e tentando impedir que suas flores fossem sopradas para longe...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 白天展現出了如此奪目美景的玫瑰庭園，也于此刻忍受著暴風，為了不讓花朵被吹走，而翻起花浪拚命抵抗…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 白天展现出了如此夺目美景的玫瑰庭园，也于此刻忍受着暴风，为了不让花朵被吹走，而翻起花浪拼命抵抗…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche il roseto che era parso così bello a mezzogiorno, stava venendo colpito dai forti venti e resisteva con tutte le sue forze, ondulando e provando ad evitare che i fiori venissero spazzati via...

Steam (ST): In that rose garden...was Shannon in the lead, Battler holding up an umbrella, Jessica, and George carrying the sleeping Maria on his back, all heading for the guesthouse.
Umineko Project (UP): Heading for the guesthouse through that rose garden, led by Shannon, were Battler, who was holding up an umbrella; Jessica; and Maria, who was sleeping on George's shoulder.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな薔薇庭園を、紗音を先頭に、傘を差した戦人、朱志香、眠っている真里亞を背負う譲治がゲストハウスへ向かっていた。
Russian (RU): По розарию, по направлении к домику для гостей, тем временем шла небольшая процессия, состоявшая из Шаннон, идущей во главе, за ней Баттлер, держащий зонтик, а за ним Джессика и Мария, посапывающая на плече у Джорджа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Indo em direção à casa de hóspedes, passando pelo jardim de rosas, sendo guiados por Shannon, enquanto Battler segurava um guarda‐chuva; Jessica; e Maria dormia nos ombros de George.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這玫瑰庭園之中，由紗音領頭，撐著傘的戰人、朱志香、還有背著睡著了的真里亞的讓治一行人正在前往賓館。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这玫瑰庭园之中，由纱音领头，撑着伞的战人、朱志香、还有背着睡着了的真里亚的让治一行人正在前往宾馆。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel roseto, con Shannon che era in testa, Battler, che stava tenendo l'ombrello, Jessica, e Maria che stava dormendo sulle spalle di George si stavano dirigendo alla casa degli ospiti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "We can at least make it to the guesthouse from here. Shannon-chan, it's fine, you should go back and rest."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's just to the guesthouse, we could make it there on our own... Shannon‐chan, it's OK, go back and rest."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ゲストハウスくらい、俺たちだけでも行けるってのに。いいんだぜ、紗音ちゃん、戻って休んでてくれよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ゲストハウスくらい、俺たちだけでも行けるってのに。いいんだぜ、紗音ちゃん、戻って休んでてくれよ」
Russian (RU): "Отсюда до домика для гостей мы уже доберемся самостоятельно. Так что, Шаннон‐чан, ты можешь спокойно идти назад и отдохнуть."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É só a casa de hóspedes, nós podemos ir sozinhos... Shannon‐chan, está tudo bem, pode voltar e descansar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「賓館這點路，光我們幾個就行了啊。不用了，紗音，回去休息吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「宾馆这点路，光我们几个就行了啊。不用了，纱音，回去休息吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Possiamo farcela da soli almeno da qui fino alla casa degli ospiti. Shannon-chan, va bene, dovresti tornare indietro e riposare."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "Don't worry, seeing you off is also part of my duty..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, no, accompanying you is also my duty..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいえ、お送りするのも仕事ですので…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいえ、お送りするのも仕事ですので…」
Russian (RU): "Что вы, проводить вас до самого конца — мой долг..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nada disso, acompanhá‐los também é parte do meu dever..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不，陪送也是我的工作…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Va tutto bene, perché accompagnarvi fino a lì è anch'esso mio dovere..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "The family conference is going on inside, and Mom and Genji-san are probably getting stressed. If we keep you, they'll misunderstand and think you were being lazy."
Umineko Project (UP): "The family conference is going on inside, and my mom and Genji‐san are on edge, that's the thing. If we're too considerate to her, they'll get the wrong idea and think she's slacking off."
PC Japanese (JP): 「親族会議中は、うちの母さんとか源次さんもぴりぴりしてるからなー。下手に私たちが気を利かせると、紗音がサボってると勘違いされちゃう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「親族会議中は、うちの母さんとか源次さんもぴりぴりしてるからなー。下手に私たちが気を利かせると、紗音がサボってると勘違いされちゃう」
Russian (RU): "Собрание семьи ведётся внутри и мама с Генджи наверняка крайне загружены. Если мы тебя задержим, они могут посчитать тебя лентяйкой."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A conferência familiar está acontecendo lá dentro, e tanto minha mãe quanto o Genji‐san estão no limite, e isso é um problema. Se formos muito considerativos com ela, eles vão acabar tendo a ideia errada e achar que ela está matando trabalho."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「在親族會議期間，我媽還有源次都緊張到了草木皆兵。我們啥都不想的好意，是會令紗音被誤會為偷懶的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「在亲族会议期间，我妈还有源次都紧张到了草木皆兵。我们啥都不想的好意，是会令纱音被误会为偷懒的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "La conferenza di famiglia si sta svolgendo dentro, e Mamma e Genji-san si stanno probabilmente stressando. Se ti tratteniamo, loro fraintenderebbero e penserebbero che stai perdendo tempo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "That's right. Just graciously accepting our offer might be the best way to avoid burdening people. ...Thank you, Shannon."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right. Just graciously accepting her offer will actually cause her less trouble. ...Thanks, Shannon."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだね。素直にお世話になった方が、むしろ迷惑を掛けないだろうね。…ありがと、紗音。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだね。素直にお世話になった方が、むしろ迷惑を掛けないだろうね。…ありがと、紗音」
Russian (RU): "Это точно. Принятие нашего предложения, возможно, является наилучшим способом для освобождения людей от лишней нагрузки. ...Спасибо, Шаннон."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo. Aceitar graciosamente sua oferta causará menos problemas. ...Obrigado, Shannon."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是呢。老老實實地接受服務，反而不會給人添麻煩啊。…謝謝，紗音。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是呢。老老实实地接受服务，反而不会给人添麻烦啊。…谢谢，纱音。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Esatto. Accettare gentilmente la nostra offerta potrebbe essere il miglior modo per evitare di creare problemi agli altri. ... Grazie, Shannon."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "Not at all. ...Certainly, as Milady has said, it is very tense inside the mansion today. Therefore, coming with all of you allowed me a breath of fresh air, and I've been able to relax a bit."
Umineko Project (UP): "Not at all. ......Certainly, as Milady says, it is very tense inside the mansion today. Coming with all of you has allowed me a breath of fresh air, and taken some of the stress off me."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいえ。……確かにお嬢様の仰られますとおり、今日のお屋敷はぴりぴりしています。だから、私も皆さんとご一緒して外の空気が吸えるので、ちょっと肩が楽です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいえ。……確かにお嬢様の仰られますとおり、今日のお屋敷はぴりぴりしています。だから、私も皆さんとご一緒して外の空気が吸えるので、ちょっと肩が楽です」
Russian (RU): "Не за что. ......Разумеется, как и сказала миледи, сегодня в особняке царит крайне напряжённая обстановка. Поэтому небольшая прогулка с вами позволила мне глотнуть свежего воздуха и немного расслабиться."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não tem de quê. ......Certamente, assim como a ojou‐sama disse, hoje o interior da mansão está bem tenso. Vir junto com vocês me permitiu respirar um pouco de ar puro e amenizar um pouco do estresse."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不用。……確實如小姐所說，今天大屋的氣氛草木皆兵。所以，跟大家一起出來，呼吸下外面的空氣，我也正好鬆口氣哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不用。……确实如小姐所说，今天大屋的气氛草木皆兵。所以，跟大家一起出来，呼吸下外面的空气，我也正好松口气哦。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Di nulla. ... Certamente, come dice Milady, oggi c'è una atmosfera molto tesa alla villa. Pertanto, venire con tutti voi mi ha permesso una boccata di aria fresca, e sono stata capace di rilassarmi un po'."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "The family conference, huh? ......They went to all the trouble of chasing us kids out, so they're probably talking about something shady."
Umineko Project (UP): "The family conference, huh. .........They went to all the trouble of chasing us kids out, so they're probably having a pretty damn nasty discussion."
PC Japanese (JP): 「親族会議、か。………わざわざ俺たち子どもを追い出すくらいだから、相当、性質の悪い話をするんだろうぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「親族会議、か。………わざわざ俺たち子どもを追い出すくらいだから、相当、性質の悪い話をするんだろうぜ」
Russian (RU): "Собрание семьи, значит. .........Они так расстарались выдворить нас, детей, наружу. Небось, наверняка говорят о чём‐то паскудном."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A conferência familiar, é...? .........Para terem se dado ao trabalho de nos expulsar, provavelmente devem estar tendo uma discussão bem sórdida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「親族會議，麼？………特意把我們這群小孩全趕走，肯定是要談性質相當惡劣的事吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「亲族会议，么？………特意把我们这群小孩全赶走，肯定是要谈性质相当恶劣的事吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "La riunione di famiglia, uh. ... Si sono presi la briga di cacciare fuori noi ragazzi, quindi staranno parlando di qualcosa di scomodo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "Probably. I'm sure there's nothing we can do to help out. Just trying to stay out of their way is probably the best way for us to be useful."
Umineko Project (UP): "Probably. I'm sure there's nothing we can do to help out. Just making sure to stay out of their way is the best way for us to be useful, I think."
PC Japanese (JP): 「だろうね。僕たちはきっと、何の力にもなれない。せめて邪魔をしないようにするのが、一番の協力だと思うよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だろうね。僕たちはきっと、何の力にもなれない。せめて邪魔をしないようにするのが、一番の協力だと思うよ」
Russian (RU): "Всё может быть. Полагаю, мы вряд ли можем что‐либо сделать, чтобы помочь им. Мы наверняка принесём им наибольшую пользу, если не станем путаться под ногами."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Provavelmente. Tenho certeza que não há nada que possamos fazer para ajudar. Acredito que garantir que não vamos atrapalhar é o melhor que podemos fazer."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「多半是吧。我們一定什麼忙都幫不上。我覺得，至少不去妨礙，就是最大的合作哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「多半是吧。我们一定什么忙都帮不上。我觉得，至少不去妨碍，就是最大的合作哦。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Probabilmente. Sono sicuro che non possiamo fare niente per aiutare. Provare a non intralciarli e basta forse è il modo migliore per renderci utili."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "Heh...! I'm sure it's all just "Money money money!".
Umineko Project (UP): "Feh......! You can bet your ass they're just going on about money money money again."
PC Japanese (JP): 「へ……！　どうせまた、カネカネカネ！って話だろうぜ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「へ……！　どうせまた、カネカネカネ！　って話だろうぜ」
Russian (RU): "Хе!.. Бьюсь об заклад, что они только и судачат, что о деньгах, деньгах да деньгах!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ehh......! Pode apostar que eles só vão ficar falando "dinheiro dinheiro dinheiro" de novo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嘿……！橫豎又是，錢錢錢！的事嘞。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嘿……！横竖又是，钱钱钱！的事嘞。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Eh...! Sono sicura che stanno solo parlando di ‘soldi, soldi, soldi’.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): ...Even though they act like they're so rich most of the time, when it gets tough, they all start getting pushy. Why don't they just be graceful and split it evenly between everyone?"
Umineko Project (UP): "...They act like they're so rich most of the time, but when it comes down to handing out cash, they start hemming and hawing. Why can't they just be generous and split it evenly between everyone?"
PC Japanese (JP): …普段、さんざん金持ちだと吹聴してるくせに、いざとなったらもったいぶりやがる。ぱーっと気前良く、みんなで山分けすりゃあいいのによ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…普段、さんざん金持ちだと吹聴してるくせに、いざとなったらもったいぶりやがる。ぱーっと気前良く、みんなで山分けすりゃあいいのによ」
Russian (RU): "...И хотя большую часть времени они строят из себя богачей, как только наступает пора давать деньги, они сразу начинают мямлить. Почему бы им просто культурно не поделиться поровну?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Eles agem o tempo todo como se fossem ricos, mas quando se trata de emprestar dinheiro, eles começam a hesitar e gaguejar. Por que eles não podem ser generosos e dividir uniformemente entre todos?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…平時麼，老是在吹噓有錢，真有事了麼，卻又假正經起來了。痛快點大大方方地大家平分不就好了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…平时么，老是在吹嘘有钱，真有事了么，却又假正经起来了。痛快点大大方方地大家平分不就好了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nonostante si comportino come se fossero così ricchi la maggior parte del tempo, quando le cose si fanno dure, iniziano tutti ad essere aggressivi. Perché non sono semplicemente generosi e se lo spartiscono equamente tra tutti?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Ihihi. That'd be awesome. It'd be nice if I got a share too. If I got some too, I'd split it with Shannon-chan right away."
Umineko Project (UP): "Ihihi. That'd be awesome. It'd be great if I got a share too. 'Cause if I got some as well, I'd split it with Shannon‐chan right away."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いっひっひ。そりゃあ豪快な話だぜ。俺にも分け前がもらえりゃいいのによ。もし俺にももらえたら、そん時ゃ紗音ちゃんにも分けてやるからなー。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いっひっひ。そりゃあ豪快な話だぜ。俺にも分け前がもらえりゃいいのによ。もし俺にももらえたら、そん時ゃ紗音ちゃんにも分けてやるからなー」
Russian (RU): "Ихи‐хи. Вот это было бы классно. А если бы ещё и мне моя доля перепала — тогда вообще зашибись. Поскольку перепади и мне чуток, я бы сразу же поделился с Шаннон‐чан."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ihihi. Isso seria incrível. Eu ficaria muito feliz se dividissem comigo também. Porque, se eu conseguisse um pouco, eu iria dividir com a Shannon‐chan agora mesmo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「咿嘿嘿。這倒豪快啊。我要是也有得分就好了。如果我有拿到，到時就給紗音也分點兒——。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「咿嘿嘿。这倒豪快啊。我要是也有得分就好了。如果我有拿到，到时就给纱音也分点儿——。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ihihi. Sarebbe magnifico. Sarebbe bello se ne avessi una parte anche io. {n}Se ne ottenessi un po' anche io, lo dividerei subito con Shannon-chan."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "Th-Thank you very much... Well, I appreciate the sentiment."
Umineko Project (UP): "Th‐thank you very much... That's alright, but I appreciate the offer."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ど、どうもありがとうございます…。お気持ちだけで嬉しいです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ど、どうもありがとうございます…。お気持ちだけで嬉しいです」
Russian (RU): "Б‐большое вам спасибо. Благодарю вас за добрые слова."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "M‐Muito obrigada... Não precisa, mas agradeço sua oferta."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「非、非常感謝…。光有這份心意，我就很高興了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「非、非常感谢…。光有这份心意，我就很高兴了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "G-Grazie molte... Beh, apprezzo il pensiero."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "Shannon isn't greedy at all. Normally, girls of your age would have tons of things they'd want to buy."
Umineko Project (UP): "You aren't materialistic at all, are you, Shannon? Normally, girls of your age have plenty of things they want to buy."
PC Japanese (JP): 「紗音は欲がないね。年頃の女の子なら、買いたいものがいっぱいあるだろうに。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「紗音は欲がないね。年頃の女の子なら、買いたいものがいっぱいあるだろうに」
Russian (RU): "Шаннон совершенно не жадная. А ведь на свете есть уйма вещей, которые хотят купить твои ровесницы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você não é nada materialista, é, Shannon? Normalmente garotas da sua idade sempre querem comprar um monte de coisas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「紗音沒有慾望呢。這年紀的女孩子，可是會有很多想買的東西的吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「纱音没有欲望呢。这年纪的女孩子，可是会有很多想买的东西的吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Shannon non è per niente avida. Normalmente, le ragazze della tua età hanno tonnellate di roba che vogliono comprare."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "I guess. But none of the things I want can be bought with money."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes. But none of the things I want can be bought with money."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうですね。でも私、欲しいものの中に、お金で買えるものがありませんので。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうですね。でも私、欲しいものの中に、お金で買えるものがありませんので」
Russian (RU): "Всё может быть. Но ни одну из желаемых мною вещей нельзя купить за деньги."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Mas nenhuma das coisas que eu quero podem ser compradas com dinheiro."

Umineko Project (UP): ".........I see. Then, no matter which way it goes, there's absolutely no need to get flustered now."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………なるほど。つまり、どっちに転ぼうとも、今さらあたふたする必要は何もないってことね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………なるほど。つまり、どっちに転ぼうとも、今さらあたふたする必要は何もないってことね」
Russian (RU): ".........Ясно. В общем, как бы всё ни обернулось, нет никакой нужды ударяться в панику."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Entendi. Então, não importa qual seja o caso, não há motivos para ficarmos frustrados agora."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………原來如此。也就是說，不管事情往哪個方向進展，現如今都沒必要慌張。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………原来如此。也就是说，不管事情往哪个方向进展，现如今都没必要慌张。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Capisco. In breve, non importa cosa deve succedere, non c'è assolutamente bisogno di agitarsi ora."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "That's it. If Father shows up, we just have to carry out the normal family conference. ......If he doesn't, we just have to keep on investigating Krauss-san."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's it. If Father shows up, it simply means that the family conference will be carried out as normal. .........If he doesn't, we just have to continue to press Krauss nii‐san."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そういうこと。お父様が現れれば、本来の親族会議が行なわれるだけの話。………現れなければ、私たちは引き続き蔵臼兄さんを追及すればいいだけの話なのよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そういうこと。お父様が現れれば、本来の親族会議が行なわれるだけの話。………現れなければ、私たちは引き続き蔵臼兄さんを追及すればいいだけの話なのよ」
Russian (RU): "Вот и всё. Если отец‐таки объявится, нам просто придётся проводить обычное собрание семьи. .........Ну а не объявится, будем постоянно подкапываться под Краусса‐сана."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo. Se o pai aparecer, simplesmente significa que a conferência familiar vai ocorrer como de costume. .........Caso contrário, só precisamos continuar a pressionar o Krauss nii‐san."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「就是如此喲。爸若是現身了的話，那就僅僅是召開原先的親族會議罷了。………爸若是不現身，那我們只需繼續追逼藏臼哥就行了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「就是如此哟。爸若是现身了的话，那就仅仅是召开原先的亲族会议罢了。………爸若是不现身，那我们只需继续追逼藏臼哥就行了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Esatto. Se nostro Padre si dovesse mostrare, dovremmo solo portare avanti la normale conferenza di famiglia. ... Se non lo fa, dovremmo solo inquisire costantemente Krauss-san."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "We can't let him talk his way out of it, ...like if he says Father's mood has suddenly gotten worse."
Umineko Project (UP): "He might start off sayin', Father's mood has suddenly gotten worse and... We gotta make absolutely sure not to let Krauss‐san talk his way out of it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お父さんの機嫌が急に悪くなって…、みたいな、蔵臼さんの言い逃れを、決して許さんようにせんとな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お父さんの機嫌が急に悪くなって…、みたいな、蔵臼さんの言い逃れを、決して許さんようにせんとな」
Russian (RU): "Мы ни за что не должны позволить ему заговорить нам зубы... Например, не принимать всерьёз его слова, будто у отца испортилось настроение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ele pode chegar dizendo que o humor do pai piorou e... Precisamos ter certeza de que não deixaremos o Krauss‐san falar sobre isto."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「俺們可決不能對，像是“爸突然心情不好了…”，的藏臼兄的托辭放行吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「俺们可决不能对，像是“爸突然心情不好了…”，的藏臼兄的托辞放行呐。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Di certo non dobbiamo lasciargli escogitare qualcosa... come dire che l'umore di nostro Padre è peggiorato improvvisamente."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "...It seems what we really should be trying to figure out... is what scheme Nii-san is going to try and trick us with. The way he just doesn't know how to give up is something I know better than anyone."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It seems what we should really be trying to figure out...is what scheme Nii‐san is going to try to use to buy himself some time. I know better than anyone just how far he'll go to refuse to admit defeat."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……どうやら、私たちが本当に検討すべきは、兄さんがどんな策を弄して、この場を誤魔化そうとしてくるかよ。往生際の悪さは私が一番よく知っているわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……どうやら、私たちが本当に検討すべきは、兄さんがどんな策を弄して、この場を誤魔化そうとしてくるかよ。往生際の悪さは私が一番よく知っているわ」
Russian (RU): "......Похоже, о чём нам действительно стоит как следует задуматься, так это о том, к какой хитрости собирается прибегнуть нии‐сан, чтобы обмануть нас. Я как никто знаю его нелюбовь сдаваться."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Parece que o que realmente estamos tentando descobrir...é que tipo de esquema o nii‐san está tentando usar para ganhar tempo. Eu sei melhor que qualquer um o quão longe ele iria para se recusar a admitir a derrota."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……看來，我們真正該研究的，是哥會怎麼耍花招，來蒙混過關呢。哥死拖到底的脾氣，我是最清楚不過的了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……看来，我们真正该研究的，是哥会怎么耍花招，来蒙混过关呢。哥死拖到底的脾气，我是最清楚不过的了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Sembra che quello che dovremmo fare veramente sia capire... con che tipo di piano Nii-san voglia provare ad ingannarci. Il modo in cui lui non sa mai quando arrendersi è qualcosa che conosco meglio di chiunque altro."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "If Father is well, ...we'll prostrate ourselves and beg for money. ...If it's a farce of Krauss-san's, then we'll continue our ugly sibling fight. ......It sounds like this year's family conference is going to be just wonderful."
Umineko Project (UP): "If Father is well, ......then we prostrate ourselves and beg for money. ......If it's Krauss nii‐san's farce, then we continue our ugly sibling fight. .........Seems like this year's family conference is going to be as wonderful as ever."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お父様がお元気なら、……私たちは土下座してお金を無心し。……蔵臼兄さんの茶番だったなら、私たちは醜い兄弟喧嘩を再開し。………今年も素敵な親族会議になりそうね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お父様がお元気なら、……私たちは土下座してお金を無心し。……蔵臼兄さんの茶番だったなら、私たちは醜い兄弟喧嘩を再開し。………今年も素敵な親族会議になりそうね」
Russian (RU): "Если отец здоров... мы падём ему в ноги и взмолимся о деньгах. ......Если же это фарс Краусса‐сана, то мы продолжим нашу уродливую ссору между братьями и сёстрами. .........М‐да, нас послушать, так преотличнейшее семейное собрание у нас получается в этом году."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se o pai estiver bem, ......então nos prostraremos e iremos implorar por dinheiro. ......Se isto for uma farsa do Krauss nii‐san, continuaremos nossa repulsiva briga de irmãos. .........Parece que a conferência familiar deste ano será maravilhosa como sempre."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「爸要是精精神神的話，……我們就下跪向爸討錢。……如果是藏臼哥在演戲的話，我們就重新開始醜惡的兄妹內鬥。………今年也會是場“妙不可言”的親族會議。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爸要是精精神神的话，……我们就下跪向爸讨钱。……如果是藏臼哥在演戏的话，我们就重新开始丑恶的兄妹内斗。………今年也会是场“妙不可言”的亲族会议。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Se nostro Padre sta bene... ci prostreremo e gli chiederemo del denaro. {n}Se è una farsa di Krauss-san, allora continueremo la nostra orribile lotta fra fratelli. ... Sembra che la riunione di famiglia di quest'anno sarà proprio meravigliosa."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Yep. So, bad thinking is no better than sleeping, huh? It's almost 22:00. ...Should we press Aniki?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Yep. The thinking of the incompetent can pass for sleeping, then. It's almost ten. ......Should we press Aniki?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「だな。下手な考え、休むに似たりってわけか。もうじき２２時だな。……兄貴に催促してみるか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だな。下手な考え、休むに似たりってわけか。もうじき２２時だな。……兄貴に催促してみるか」
Russian (RU): "Да уж. Итак, глупые мысли не лучше сна. Уже почти десять. ......Стоит ли надавить на Аники?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Realmente. O pensamento de um incompetente não é melhor do que o de alguém que está dormindo. Já são quase dez horas. ......Deveríamos pressionar o aniki?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊。胡思亂想不是等於浪費時間麼？馬上就要二十二點了啊。……要不，去催下大哥？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊。胡思乱想不是等于浪费时间么？马上就要二十二点了啊。……要不，去催下大哥？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Già. Perciò, i pensieri stupidi sono peggio che dormire. Sono quasi le 22:00. ... Dovremmo mettere pressione ad Aniki?"

Steam (ST): Rudolf and the rest looked at Krauss.
Umineko Project (UP): Rudolf and the rest looked at Krauss.
PC Japanese (JP): 留弗夫たちは、蔵臼の様子をうかがう。
Russian (RU): Рудольф и остальные взглянули на Краусса.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rudolf, assim como os outros, olharam para Krauss.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 留弗夫等人瞄了一眼藏臼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rudolf e gli altri guardarono Krauss.

Steam (ST): He was sitting down firmly...and looked like he was awaiting Kinzo's arrival with an air of composure.
Umineko Project (UP): Firmly seated, he looked like he was awaiting Kinzo's arrival with an air of composure.
PC Japanese (JP): どっかりと腰を下ろし、悠然と、金蔵が来臨するのを待っているように見える。
Russian (RU): Тот, в свою очередь, продолжал сидеть в ожидании Кинзо, источая при этом ауру собранности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Firmemente sentado, ela parecia estar esperando a chegada de Kinzo, com um ar de compostura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 藏臼看起來就像是在穩如泰山、悠然地坐等金藏到來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 藏臼看起来就像是在稳如泰山、悠然地坐等金藏到来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lui era seduto, e sembrava stesse aspettando l'arrivo di Kinzo con un'aria composta.

Steam (ST): ...They couldn't tell if he really was composed, ...or if he was scheming about how to tie together his lie.
Umineko Project (UP): ......They couldn't tell whether that really was composure, or whether he was scheming about how to tie together his lie.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それが、悠然となのか、自らの嘘をどのように帳尻を合わせようと策を巡らしているのかは、わからない。
Russian (RU): ......Те не могли сказать, действительно ли он собран, либо же отчаянно хитрит, стремясь спасти свою шкуру.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eles não podiam afirmar que aquilo era realmente compostura, ou se algum estava esquematizando como entrelaçar suas mentiras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這到底是心中有底，還是在思索著要怎麼圓自己的謊言，就不知道了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这到底是心中有底，还是在思索着要怎么圆自己的谎言，就不知道了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Non potevano dire se quella fosse davvero compostezza, o se stesse architettando come mettere insieme i pezzi della sua bugia.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "...Calm yourself. We won't get anywhere by making a fuss after all this. ......Let's leave it to Genji-san."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Calm yourself. Making a fuss here won't achieve anything. .........Let's leave it to Genji‐san."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……落ち着きなさい。もう今さらじたばたしても始まらん。………源次さんに任せよう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……落ち着きなさい。もう今さらじたばたしても始まらん。………源次さんに任せよう」
Russian (RU): "......Расслабься. Нам только выйдет боком, если мы поднимем шум после всего этого. .........Доверимся Генджи‐сану."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Acalme‐se. Fazer um alarde aqui não levará a lugar nenhum. .........Vamos deixar isto para o Genji‐san."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……冷靜點。現如今著急也沒用。………交給源次吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……冷静点。现如今着急也没用。………交给源次吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Calmati. Non andremo da nessuna parte facendo storie dopotutto questo. ... Lasciamo tutto nelle mani di Genji-san."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "It's almost...10:00, isn't it?"
Umineko Project (UP): "It's almost......ten o'clock, isn't it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「もうじき、……１０時ですね。」
Russian (RU): "Уже... почти десять, не так ли."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Já são quase......dez horas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「馬上就要到，……十點了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「马上就要到，……十点了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sono quasi le... 10:00, no."

Steam (ST): That was the time that had been set for tonight's family conference to open.
Umineko Project (UP): That was the time that had been set for tonight's family conference to open.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、今夜の親族会議の開催として定められた時刻だった。
Russian (RU): Это было время, знаменовавшее открытие семейного собрания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esse foi o horário definido para que a conferência familiar desta noite tivesse início.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 十點是今晚親族會議的預定開會時間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 十点是今晚亲族会议的预定开会时间。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quello era il momento che era stabilito per iniziare la conferenza di famiglia di quella notte.

Steam (ST): And, it was the time that the Ushiromiya Family Head needed to appear...
Umineko Project (UP): And in addition, it was also the time that the Ushiromiya family head needed to appear......
PC Japanese (JP): そして同時に、右代宮家当主が現れなければならない時刻でもある……。
Russian (RU): То было время, по наступлении которого главе семьи Уширомия надлежало появиться перед своими родственниками...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E mais, era também o momento em que o chefe da família Ushiromiya deveria aparecer......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 同時，也是右代宮家當主必須現身的時間……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 同时，也是右代宫家当主必须现身的时间……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E allo stesso momento, era il momento in cui c'era bisogno che apparisse il capofamiglia Ushiromiya...

Steam (ST): Right then, they heard the sound of footsteps approaching from the hall. There were multiple sets.
Umineko Project (UP): Right then, they heard the sound of footsteps approaching from the hall.{n}There were multiple sets.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、廊下から足音が近付いてくるのが聞こえた。それも複数。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その時、廊下から足音が近付いてくるのが聞こえた。{n}それも複数。
Russian (RU): И тут они услышали приближающийся звук шагов из коридора.{n}То были звуки шагов, создаваемые несколькими людьми.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele momento, eles começaram a ouvir o som de passos se aproximando vindo do corredor.{n}Haviam múltiplos passos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正在此時，從走廊上傳來了由遠至近的腳步聲。{n}而且，不是一個人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正在此时，从走廊上传来了由远至近的脚步声。{n}而且，不是一个人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Proprio allora, sentirono il suono di passi avvicinarsi alla hall. Erano molteplici.

Steam (ST): Natsuhi raised her head, relieved...
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi jerked her head up with a start......
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃は、はっとして顔を上げる……。
Russian (RU): Нацухи подняла голову с выражением явного облегчения на лице...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi ergueu seu rosto, aliviada......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃猛地抬起頭來……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃猛地抬起头来……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Natsuhi alzò il capo, sollevata...

Steam (ST): But because of the sound of a knock, her expression was filled with disappointment.
Umineko Project (UP): But there came the sound of a knock, and her expression filled with disappointment.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、ノックの音だったため、その表情には失望が浮かぶのだった。
Russian (RU): Однако после стука в дверь облегчение сменилось разочарованием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas o que veio foi o som de uma batida na porta, e logo sua expressão foi preenchida pelo desapontamento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，由於聽到了敲門聲，她的臉上浮現出了失望。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，由于听到了敲门声，她的脸上浮现出了失望。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma per via di un bussare, la sua espressione si riempì di disappunto.

Steam (ST): Because Kinzo probably wouldn't have knocked.
Umineko Project (UP): Because Kinzo probably wouldn't have knocked.
PC Japanese (JP): なぜなら、金蔵だったなら、ノックなどしないだろうからだ。
Russian (RU): Потому что Кинзо вряд ли бы стал стучать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque Kinzo muito provavelmente não iria bater.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要問為什麼的話，因為，如果來的是金藏，那就不會敲門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要问为什么的话，因为，如果来的是金藏，那就不会敲门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perché Kinzo probabilmente non avrebbe bussato.

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Steam (ST): "...Please excuse us. I have finished closing up the mansion for the night."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Please excuse us. We have finished closing up the mansion for the night."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……失礼いたします。戸締りの見回りが終わりました。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……失礼いたします。戸締りの見回りが終わりました」
Russian (RU): "......Прошу нас извинить. Я закончил запирать особняк на ночь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Por favor, com licença. Nós terminamos de fechar a mansão para o turno da noite."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……失禮了。檢查門窗上鎖情況的巡視已經完成。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……失礼了。检查门窗上锁情况的巡视已经完成。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Vi prego di scusarci. Abbiamo finito di chiudere la villa per la notte."

Steam (ST): It was Gohda and Kumasawa.
Umineko Project (UP): It was Gohda and Kumasawa.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田と熊沢だった。
Russian (RU): Это оказались Года с Кумасавой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eram Gohda e Kumasawa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 來的是鄉田與熊澤。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 来的是乡田与熊泽。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erano Gohda e Kumasawa.

Steam (ST): Unlike the powerful Gohda, it was rare for Kumasawa, with her old body, to be forced to work this late.
Umineko Project (UP): Unlike the physically fit Gohda, it was rare for Kumasawa with her old body to still be tasked with work this late.
PC Japanese (JP): 体力のある郷田ならともかく、老体の熊沢がこの時間にまだ勤務を強いられているのはとても珍しいことだった。
Russian (RU): В отличие от могучего Годы для Кумасавы с её старым телом было редкостью работать так поздно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Diferente do corpulento Gohda, era raro para Kumasawa, com seu corpo decrépito, cumprir com as tarefas a esta hora da noite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 體力不錯的鄉田還好說，不過，讓年老體弱的熊澤加班到這麼晚，這是非常罕見的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 体力不错的乡田还好说，不过，让年老体弱的熊泽加班到这么晚，这是非常罕见的事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A differenza del potente Gohda, era raro per Kumasawa con il suo vecchio corpo essere obbligata a lavorare così tardi.

Steam (ST): Of course, Krauss also seemed to know that.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, Krauss also seemed to know that.
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、それを蔵臼もわかっているようだった。
Russian (RU): Краусс, разумеется, тоже знал об этом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, Krauss também já sabia disto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，藏臼似乎也明白這點。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "Indeed. Good work. ......My apologies for making you work at such a time, Kumasawa-san."
Umineko Project (UP): "Mmhm. Good work. .........My apologies for making you work at such a time, Kumasawa‐san."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うむ。ご苦労だった。………こんな時間まで申し訳ないね、熊沢さん」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯。辛苦了。………要到这么晚真不好意思，熊泽女士。」

Speaker: Kumasawa Chiyo
Steam (ST): "Oh, it's nothing. I may not look it, but staying up late is still one of my specialties. Hohohohoh...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, not at all. I may not look it, but staying up late is still one of my specialties. Hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐ho...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいえぇ。こう見えても、まだまだ夜更かしは得意でございますので。ほっほっほっほ…！」
Russian (RU): "О, да ничего страшного. По мне, может, и не скажешь, но задерживаться допоздна — одна из моих специальностей. Хо‐хо‐хо‐хо!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ora, não foi nada demais. Posso não aparentar, mas permanecer acordada até tarde é uma das minhas especialidades. Hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐ho...!"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Oh, non è niente. Può non sembrare, ma stare alzata così tardi è una delle mie specialità. Hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh...!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "...Wouldn't it be okay to at least let Kumasawa leave without being an observer? It really will be difficult on her body, I imagine."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Could we not at least relieve Kumasawa of the duty of being an observer? It really will be difficult on her body, I imagine."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……熊沢についてだけは、立会いを外させてもよいのでは。さすがに体に堪えるでしょう」
Russian (RU): "......Не будет ли правильно с нашей стороны отпустить хотя бы Кумасаву отдыхать? Ей при её возрасте может прийтись нелегко."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……光就熊泽来说，卸去见证人的职责也无妨吧？身体会吃不消的。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "......The order was to gather all of the servants as well. I cannot disobey."
Umineko Project (UP): "............The order was to gather all of the servants as well. I cannot disobey."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………使用人も全員揃えろとの命令だ。逆らえん」

Steam (ST): Tonight's family conference was clearly different from normal.
Umineko Project (UP): Tonight's family conference was clearly different from a normal one.
PC Japanese (JP): 今夜の親族会議は、例年の親族会議とは明らかに違った。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 今年的亲族会议与往年的亲族会议明显不同。

Steam (ST): On a normal year, no one was allowed to attend except family members. To have the servants present for such a thing...was unthinkable.
Umineko Project (UP): On a normal year, no one was able to attend the family conference except relatives.{n}It would have been inconceivable for any servants to be present.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 例年ならば、親族会議は親族以外、出席できない。{n}使用人が居合わせるなど、ありえないことだ。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em um ano normal, não seria permitido a ninguém participar da conferência, com exceção dos parentes.{n}Era inconcebível que qualquer serviçal estivesse presente.

Steam (ST): All of the servants were told to attend. Of course, they were not allowed to talk. ......They were there as observers.

Umineko Project (UP): Just what in the world was going to happen that needed five servants to observe?

Chinese Simplified (CN): 要多达五位佣人来见证，到底是要搞什么呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Cosa diavolo sarebbe successo che aveva bisogno di cinque domestici come osservatori?

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ほっほっほ。徹夜はこう見えても強いんですよ。旦那様も鯖をもりもり食べれば、夜ももっとたくましくなれますよ」
Russian (RU): "Хо‐хо‐хо. По моему виду, быть может, и не скажешь, но поздняя ночь мне не помеха. А если вы, Краусс‐сама, набьёте себе живот скумбрией, то сможете быть помужественне по ночам."

Steam (ST): "Hahahaha. I see you're still in high spirits. I'm sure you'll be working in such high spirits until you're a hundred."

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro

Umineko Project (UP): "Madam. Forgive my presumption, but I have prepared a light snack. It is ready to be served at any time—just give the word."

Umineko Project (UP): "Certainly."

Russian (RU): Генджи и Канон обычно скромно стучали в дверь.{n}Они бы не стали так молотить по ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tanto Genji quanto Kanon costumavam ser bem reservados quando batiam na porta. Eles não iriam bater na porta com tamanha força e violência.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次與嘉音在敲門時會非常注意力道。{n}不會如此粗暴地用力敲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次与嘉音在敲门时会非常注意力道。{n}不会如此粗暴地用力敲。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sia Genji che Kanon erano di solito molto riservati quando bussavano. {n}Non avrebbero colpito la porta con una tale forza violenta.

Steam (ST): ...It was like a judge's gavel slamming down in a call for silence.
Umineko Project (UP): ......It was like a judge's gavel slamming down in a call to order.
PC Japanese (JP): ……まるで、静粛にと言いながら打ち鳴らされる裁判官の槌のようだった。
Russian (RU): ......Это напоминало стук молоточка судьи, призывавшего к тишине.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Foi como o martelo de um juiz batendo para pedir ordem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……那簡直就像是伴隨著“肅靜”砰砰敲下的法官之槌的槌音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……那简直就像是伴随着“肃静”砰砰敲下的法官之槌的槌音。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Era come il martelletto di un giudice che veniva sbattuto per chiamare il silenzio.

Steam (ST): So, everyone went quiet...
Umineko Project (UP): So everyone fell quiet......
PC Japanese (JP): だから、一同はシンと静まり返った……。
Russian (RU): Поэтому все замолчали...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso todos caíram em silêncio......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，大家一同靜了下來……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，大家一同静了下来……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi tutti fecero silenzio...

Steam (ST): The door opened slightly, ...and Genji showed himself.
Umineko Project (UP): The door opened slightly, ......and Genji showed himself.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉が細く開き、……源次が姿を見せる。
Russian (RU): Дверь слегка приоткрылась... Явив Генджи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A porta se abriu levemente, ......e Genji apareceu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 門開了一條縫，……源次露了面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 门开了一条缝，……源次露了面。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La porta si aprì leggermente... e Genji si mostrò.

Steam (ST): Then, he spoke with a serious tone different from his usual one. It wasn't the tone he used when carrying out his duties. ...It was the tone he used when speaking for Kinzo himself.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, he spoke with a solemn tone different from his usual one.{n}It wasn't the tone he used when carrying out his duties.{n}......It was the tone he used when speaking for Kinzo himself.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、普段とは違う厳かな口調で言った。それは彼が職務を遂行する時の口調ではない。……彼が、金蔵の言葉を代弁する時の口調だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして、普段とは違う厳かな口調で言った。{n}それは彼が職務を遂行する時の口調ではない。{n}……彼が、金蔵の言葉を代弁する時の口調だ。
Russian (RU): А затем он заговорил серьёзным тоном, отличающимся от его обычного.{n}То был не тон, которым он говорил, когда исполнял свои обязанности.{n}......Это был тон, которым он говорил, выступая от лица самого Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ele falou com um tom solene, diferente de seu habitual.{n}Não era o tom de voz que ele utilizava quando estava cumprindo com seus deveres. ......Era um tom de voz que ele usava quando falava por Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，他以與平時不同的嚴肅口吻開了口。{n}這並非是他盡職務時所用的口吻。{n}……而是，他代言金藏的話時所用的口吻。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，他以与平时不同的严肃口吻开了口。{n}这并非是他尽职务时所用的口吻。{n}……而是，他代言金藏的话时所用的口吻。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi, parlò con un tono serio diverso da quello solito. Non era il tono che usava quando svolgeva i suoi doveri. ... Era quello che usava quando parlava per Kinzo stesso.

Steam (ST): So just by hearing Genji speak like that, the siblings were struck with a sudden tension.
Umineko Project (UP): So just by hearing Genji speak like that, the siblings were struck with a sudden tension.
PC Japanese (JP): だから源次がその口調をしただけで、兄弟たちには緊張感が走るのだ。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, уже услышав его речь, братья и сёстры ощутили внезапное напряжение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, apenas de ouvir Genji falando daquela forma, os irmãos foram pegos por uma tensão repentina.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，光是聽到源次這語調，几兄妹就感到了陣陣緊張襲上心頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，光是听到源次这语调，几兄妹就感到了阵阵紧张袭上心头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Solo sentendo Genji parlare così, i fratelli furono colti da una improvvisa tensione.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "Take your seats, everyone."
Umineko Project (UP): "Take your seats, everyone."
PC Japanese (JP): 「皆様、ご着席を。」
Russian (RU): "Пожалуйста, все, займите свои места."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Tomem seus assentos, pessoal."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「諸位，請就坐。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「诸位，请就坐。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Per favore prendete posto, tutti quanti."

Steam (ST): At those words, the dining hall was wrapped in total silence, and everyone hurriedly returned to their designated seats.
Umineko Project (UP): At those words, the dining hall fell into complete silence, and everyone rushed back to their designated seats.
PC Japanese (JP): その言葉に、食堂は完全に沈黙し、みんな慌てて自分の序列の席に戻る。
Russian (RU): После этих слов в обеденном зале повисла абсолютная тишина, и все торопливо вернулись на положенные им места.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Diante daquelas palavras, a sala de jantar ficou em silêncio absoluto, e todos rapidamente se dirigiram aos seus lugares.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨著這一句話，餐廳完全沉寂了下來，大家慌慌張張地回到了自己序列的位子上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着这一句话，餐厅完全沉寂了下来，大家慌慌张张地回到了自己序列的位子上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A quelle parole, nella sala da pranzo calò il completo silenzio, e tutti si affrettarono a tornare a i loro posti designati.

Steam (ST): It was as though students who had been bustling around just before homeroom had suddenly returned to their seats when the teacher came, and it might even have looked humorous.
Umineko Project (UP): They were like students who had been making a lot of noise just before homeroom, hurriedly returning to their seats when the teacher came; it might even have felt humorous.
PC Japanese (JP): まるで、ホームルーム直前まで騒いでいた生徒たちが、先生が来て大急ぎで席に戻るような、そんな滑稽さも感じられたかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Это походило на школьников, которые забавлялись перед началом урока, но потом внезапно уселись на свои места, когда вернулся учитель, поэтому данное зрелище могло показаться забавным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eram como estudantes que sempre faziam barulho antes da aula começar, e rapidamente retornavam às suas classes quando o professor aparecia; chegava a ser cômico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像在晨會前吵吵鬧鬧的學生們，一看老師來了，就急忙跑回自己位子上般，或許會給人一種恰似這樣的滑稽感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像在晨会前吵吵闹闹的学生们，一看老师来了，就急忙跑回自己位子上般，或许会给人一种恰似这样的滑稽感。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fu come se degli studenti che fino all'inizio delle lezioni se ne stavano sparpagliati per la stanza tornassero improvvisamente ai loro posti all'arrivo del professore, e potrebbe sembrare persino comico.

Steam (ST): ...But there was no way anyone would joke about it.
Umineko Project (UP): ......But there was no way anyone would joke about it.
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、そうだと茶化せる人間など、いるはずもなかった。
Russian (RU): ......Однако никому не хотелось шутить на эту тему.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas não haviam como alguém brincar sobre isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，就是根本沒人能把這玩笑說出口。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，就是根本没人能把这玩笑说出口。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma era impossibile che qualcuno ci scherzasse.

Steam (ST): Everyone sat in order, and Shannon, Gohda, and Kumasawa stood up straight in a row by the wall.
Umineko Project (UP): Everyone sat in order, and Shannon, Gohda, and Kumasawa stood up straight in a row by the wall.
PC Japanese (JP): 全員が整然と着席し、紗音、郷田、熊沢も壁際に整列し背筋を伸ばす。
Russian (RU): Все расселись в обусловленном порядке, а Шаннон, Года и Кумасава встали в ряд у стены.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos sentaram em ordem, e Shannon, Gohda e Kumasawa permaneceram de pé, lado a lado, próximos à parede.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 全體整然就坐，紗音、鄉田、熊澤也挺直腰板，在牆邊排成了整齊的一列。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 全体整然就坐，纱音、乡田、熊泽也挺直腰板，在墙边排成了整齐的一列。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ognuno si sedette in ordine, e Shannon, Gohda, e Kumasawa rimasero fermi in fila attaccati al muro.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "...The Head of the glorious Ushiromiya family and lord of Rokkenjima, the island that sparkles gold, ...Lord Ushiromiya Kinzo has arrived."
Umineko Project (UP): "......The head of the glorious Ushiromiya family, and lord of Rokkenjima, the island that sparkles gold. Lord Ushiromiya Kinzo is present."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……栄光ある右代宮家の当主にして、金色に輝ける六軒島の領主。右代宮金蔵卿の、御成りであります。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……栄光ある右代宮家の当主にして、金色に輝ける六軒島の領主。右代宮金蔵卿の、御成りであります」
Russian (RU): "......Глава славной семьи Уширомия, господин Роккенджимы — острова сверкающего золота. Лорд Уширомия Кинзо прибыл."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O chefe da gloriosa família Ushiromiya, lorde de Rokkenjima, a ilha que reluz em ouro. O Lorde Ushiromiya Kinzo está presente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……榮光顯赫的右代宮家的當主，金光閃耀的六軒島的領主。右代宮金藏卿，駕到。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……荣光显赫的右代宫家的当主，金光闪耀的六轩岛的领主。右代宫金藏卿，驾到。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Il capo della gloriosa famiglia Ushiromiya, e signore di Rokkenjima, l'isola che brilla d'oro. Lord Ushiromiya Kinzo è presente."

Steam (ST): Of the double doors that led to the dining hall, Genji opened the right door from the inside, and Kanon opened the left door from the outside.
Umineko Project (UP): Of the double doors into the dining hall, Genji opened the right door from the inside, and Kanon opened the left door from the outside.
PC Japanese (JP): 食堂への観音開きの扉を、源次が内側から右の扉を、そして左の扉を外側から嘉音が開く。
Russian (RU): В обеденный зал вела двойная дверь. Генджи открыл правую дверь изнутри, а Канон — левую снаружи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Das portas duplas da sala de jantar, o lado direito foi aberto por dentro por Genji, e Kanon abriu o lado esquerdo pelo lado de fora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次從內側拉開了餐廳正門的右半邊門，嘉音從外側拉開了左半邊門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次从内侧拉开了餐厅正门的右半边门，嘉音从外侧拉开了左半边门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Della doppia porta che conduceva alla sala da pranzo, Genji aprì la porta destra dall'interno, e Kanon quella sinistra dall'esterno.

Steam (ST): ...And, welcomed by a respectful bow from those two, majestically fluttering his cape, ......Kinzo appeared...
Umineko Project (UP): ......And, welcomed by the deepest of bows from the two servants, with his cape fluttering majestically, ............Kinzo appeared......
PC Japanese (JP): ……そしてその二人の最敬礼に迎えられながら、威圧感でローブをなびかせながら、…………金蔵が姿を現す……。
Russian (RU): ......И, приветствуемый почтительными кивками обеих слуг, в величественно развивающемся плаще... Возник Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E, recebido por dois serviçais, que se curvaram profundamente em sua presença, com sua capa esvoaçando majestosamente, ............Kinzo deu as caras......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……接著，邊受兩人最敬重的一禮的迎接，邊以威壓感鼓動長袍的金藏，…………現身了……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……接着，边受两人最敬重的一礼的迎接，边以威压感鼓动长袍的金藏，…………现身了……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... E, accolto da un rispettoso inchino da parte di quei due, maestosamente agitando il suo mantello... Kinzo apparve...

Steam (ST): Kinzo's gait had a dignified weight to it, and it was hard to believe that he had reportedly been at the end of his life.
Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo's gait had a dignified weight to it, and it was very hard to believe that he had been diagnosed as having not much time left to live.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵の足取りは貫禄ある重みがあり、とても余命幾ばくを宣告されたとは思えないものだった。
Russian (RU): Походка и осанка Кинзо также отличались величественностью и с трудом верилось, что он должен был находиться одной ногой в могиле.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo marchou dignamente sala adentro; era muito difícil de se acreditar que ele havia sido diagnosticado como tendo pouco tempo restante de vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏的步伐威風凜凜落地有聲，怎麼都沒法把他聯想成余命無幾之人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏的步伐威风凛凛落地有声，怎么都没法把他联想成余命无几之人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il passo di Kinzo aveva un peso dignitoso in esso, ed era difficile credere che fosse stato riferito che fosse alla fine della sua vita.

Steam (ST): Genji pulled back Kinzo's seat and motioned for him to sit.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji pulled back Kinzo's seat, and motioned for him to sit.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次が金蔵の席を引き、着席を促す。
Russian (RU): Генджи отодвинул сиденье Кинзо и почтительным жестом пригласил того присесть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji puxou o assentou de Kinzo e gesticulou para que o mesmo se sentasse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次抽出金藏的坐椅，請主人就坐。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次抽出金藏的坐椅，请主人就坐。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Genji tirò indietro la sedia di Kinzo, e si mosse per farlo sedere.

Steam (ST): But Kinzo stayed standing, signaling with his chin for Genji to move back.
Umineko Project (UP): But Kinzo remained standing, signaling with his chin for Genji to move back.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし金蔵は座らず、源次に下がれという風に顎で合図する。
Russian (RU): Тем не менее, Кинзо остался стоять, подав подбородком Генджи знак отойти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas Kinzo permaneceu de pé, assinalando com seu queixo para que Genji se afastasse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，金藏並未坐下，他以下巴示意源次退下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，金藏并未坐下，他以下巴示意源次退下。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma Kinzo rimase in piedi, facendo segno col suo mento a Genji di indietreggiare.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle* Fuhhahahahahahahahahaha...!! Welcome to Rokkenjima, ladies and gentlemen. Why the frightened face, Evaa?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Hhheheheheheheheh, fuhha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}hahaha...!! Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, to Rokkenjima. Why the frightened face, Evaa?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「くっくくくくくくくくく、ふっはははははははははは…！！　ようこそ諸君、六軒島へ。何を怯えた顔をしておるのか、絵羽ァ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「くっくくくくくくくくく、ふっはははははははははは…！！　ようこそ諸君、六軒島へ。何を怯えた顔をしておるのか、絵羽ァ」
Russian (RU): "*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*, Фха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха!!! Добро пожаловать на Роккенджиму, дамы и господа. Что за испуганное лицо, Ева?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hhheheheheheheheh, fuhha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}ha{0}hahaha...!! Senhoras e senhores, sejam bem‐vindos a Rokkenjima. Por que essa cara tão assustada, Evaa?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呵、呵呵呵呵呵呵呵呵呵，哼、哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈…！！諸位，歡迎來到六軒島。擺出這副臉是在怕什麼呀，繪羽——？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呵、呵呵呵呵呵呵呵呵呵，哼、哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈…！！诸位，欢迎来到六轩岛。摆出这副脸是在怕什么呀，绘羽——？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*, fuhhahahahahahahahahaha...!! {n}Benvenuti a Rokkenjima, signore e signori. Perché quella faccia spaventata, Eva?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "N-No, why would I be frightened...! I'm just relieved to find you in excellent spirits, Father..."
Umineko Project (UP): "N‐no, why would I be frightened...! I, I'm just relieved to find you in excellent spirits, Father......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「い、いえ、そんな怯えてるなんて…！　お、お父様が大変お元気そうなので、ほっとしただけで……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「い、いえ、そんな怯えてるなんて…！　お、お父様が大変お元気そうなので、ほっとしただけで……」
Russian (RU): "Н‐нет, с чего бы мне бояться! Я просто испытала облегчение, увидев тебя в добром здравии, отец..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "N‐Não, por que eu estaria assustada...?! E‐Eu só estou aliviada em vê‐lo em tão alto astral, pai......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不、不，我沒在害怕…！只、只是由於看到爸容光煥發，而鬆了一口氣……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不、不，我没在害怕…！只、只是由于看到爸容光焕发，而松了一口气……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "N-No, perché dovrei essere spaventata...! Sono solo sollevata nel trovarti ottimamente, Padre..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Wahhahhahhahhahhahha...!! Evaa, you're as amusing as ever, aren't yoou? Why don't you just honestly say how frustrated you are at losing your bet with Krauss? ...*cackle*cackle* You can't say it, can you? *cackle*cackle*!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Wahahahaha...!! Evaa, you're as interesting as ever, aren't yoou? You might try honestly saying how frustrated you are at losing your bet with Krauss. ......Heheh{0}ha{0}ha{0}hah, you can't say it, can youuu? Hehuhuha{0}ha{0}ha{0}hah!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「わっはっはっはっはっは…！！絵羽ァ、お前は相変わらず面白いなぁ？　蔵臼との賭けに負けて悔しいと素直に言えばよいのに。……くっくくくく、言えないよなァ。くっくっくっく！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わっはっはっはっはっは…！！　絵羽ァ、お前は相変わらず面白いなぁ？　蔵臼との賭けに負けて悔しいと素直に言えばよいのに。……くっくくくく、言えないよなァ。くっくっくっく！！」
Russian (RU): "Вах‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха!!! Ева‐а, ты всё такая же интересная, а? Тебе следует попытаться честно сказать, как ты злишься из‐за проигранного Крауссу пари. ......*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*, а не можешь, не так ли? *хи‐хи*хи‐хи*!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Wahahahaha...!! Evaa, você continua divertida como sempre, não é meeesmo? Talvez esteja tentando dizer honestamente como se sente frustrada porque perdeu sua aposta com o Krauss? ......Heheh{0}ha{0}ha{0}hah, não consegue dizer, conseeegue? Hehuhuha{0}ha{0}ha{0}hah!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哇哈哈哈哈哈…！！繪羽——，你依舊是這麼好玩呢。老老實實地講，與藏臼賭輸了好不爽，不就行了？……呵、呵呵呵呵，說不出來呢——。呵呵呵呵！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哇哈哈哈哈哈…！！绘羽——，你依旧是这么好玩呢。老老实实地讲，与藏臼赌输了好不爽，不就行了？……呵、呵呵呵呵，说不出来呢——。呵呵呵呵！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Wahhahhahhahhahhahha...!! Eva, sei interessante come sempre, vero? {n}Potresti provare mestamente a dire quanto sei frustrata per aver perso la tua scommessa con Krauss. ... *cackle*cackle*, non riesci a dirlo, vero? *cackle*cackle*!!"

Steam (ST): Eva realized that their conversation during the day had indeed been leaked to Kinzo, and she hung her head, turning red.
Umineko Project (UP): Eva realized that their conversation during the day had indeed been an open book to Kinzo, and she turned red as she hung her head.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Well then, my sons and daughters and their companions! Tonight, I shall make an important announcement regarding my inheritance and the succession that you all seem so keen on."
Umineko Project (UP): "Well then, my sons, daughters, and their companions! Tonight, I shall make an important announcement regarding those things that you all have your hearts set upon: my fortune and the succession of the headship."
PC Japanese (JP): 「さぁってと、我が息子たち娘たち、そしてその伴侶の諸君！　お前たちの執心している我が財産と当主の継承について、今宵は重要な発表をしようと思う。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「さぁってと、我が息子たち娘たち、そしてその伴侶の諸君！　お前たちの執心している我が財産と当主の継承について、今宵は重要な発表をしようと思う」
Russian (RU): "Ну что ж, мои сыновья, дочери, их спутники и спутницы! Сегодня я сделаю наиважнейшее заявление о своем наследстве и преемнике, на которых у вас свет клином сошёлся."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Pois bem, meus filhos, filhas e seus cônjuges! Esta noite, devo fazer um importante anúncio em relação àquilo que todos vocês tanto se interessam: minha fortuna e a sucessão da liderança da família."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那——麼，吾之兒女，及他們伴侶的諸位！我想就你們時刻惦記著的吾之財產與當主繼承一事，在今宵發表重要的決定。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那——么，吾之儿女，及他们伴侣的诸位！我想就你们时刻惦记着的吾之财产与当主继承一事，在今宵发表重要的决定。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Bene allora, miei figli e mie figlie, e loro compagni! Stanotte, farò un importante annuncio riguardante la mia eredità e la successione di cui siete tanto appassionati.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "But first! I must tell you how incredibly disappointed I am. After all, until this very day, no one has been able to solve the riddle of the epitaph."
Umineko Project (UP): "But first! I think I will mention how incredibly disappointed I am. I refer to the fact that, to this very day, not a single one of you has been able to solve the riddle of the epitaph."
PC Japanese (JP): まず最初に！　私はひどく失望していることを伝えようと思う。それは、今日まで誰にもあの碑文の謎を解くことが出来なかったということだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「まず最初に！　私はひどく失望していることを伝えようと思う。それは、今日まで誰にもあの碑文の謎を解くことが出来なかったということだ」
Russian (RU): "Но сначала! Полагаю, мне следует упомянуть, как сильно я разочарован. Поскольку до сегодняшнего дня никто так и не разгадал загадку эпитафии."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mas antes! Acredito que devo mencionar o quão desapontado eu estou.{n}Refiro‐me ao fato de que, até este exato dia, nenhum de vocês foi capaz de resolver o enigma do epitáfio."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「首先，第一件事！我想告訴你們，我十分地失望。這是因為，直到今日，誰都沒能解開那個碑文之謎。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「首先，第一件事！我想告诉你们，我十分地失望。这是因为，直到今日，谁都没能解开那个碑文之谜。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma prima! Credo che farò menzione di quanto sono incredibilmente deluso. Questo perché fino ad oggi, nessuno è stato capace di risolvere l'enigma dell'epigrafe."

Steam (ST): Even though Kinzo said he was disappointed, a condescending smile rose to his face, as though there was no way the likes of these could've solved it, and his gaze passed through all of them.
Umineko Project (UP): Even though Kinzo said he was disappointed, a condescending smile, as though there was no way the likes of them could have solved it, rose to his face as he cast an eye over each and every one of them.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は失望という言葉を口にはしながらも、貴様ら如きに解けるものかとでも言うような見下した笑みを浮かべ、ぎょろりと一同を見渡す。
Russian (RU): Но хотя Кинзо и говорил, будто он разочарован, самодовольная улыбка, словно говорящая, что никто из этих ни в жисть бы не разгадал её, заиграла у него на лице, пока он оглядывал их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo Kinzo tendo dito que estava desapontado, um condescende sorriso, como se dissesse que nenhum deles era capaz de resolver, surgiu em seu rosto conforme ele olhava para cada um deles.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏虽然嘴上说着“失望”，脸上却浮现了仿佛在说“就凭你们，哪解得开”的藐视笑容，环视房内众人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nonostante Kinzo avesse detto che era deluso, un sorriso condiscendente, come se non ci fosse modo per loro di risolverlo, spuntò sul suo viso, e il suo sguardo li scrutò tutti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "...I had planned to hand over everything to the one who could solve it. But none have been able to solve it before today, and here we stand, with nothing of mine passed down to anyone."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I had been planning on handing over everything to the person who could solve it. But here we stand today, not a single person having been capable, and not a single person having succeeded to all that is mine."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………私は、あれを解けた者に、全てを譲り渡すつもりでいた。しかし、今日までに誰も解くことが出来ず、我が全ては誰にも継承されることなく、ここに至っているわけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………私は、あれを解けた者に、全てを譲り渡すつもりでいた。しかし、今日までに誰も解くことが出来ず、我が全ては誰にも継承されることなく、ここに至っているわけだ」
Russian (RU): "......Я намеревался отдать всё человеку, который окажется способен разгадать её. Но сейчас мы достигли этапа, на котором никто её не разгадал и ничего из принадлежащего мне не было передано кому‐либо."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我，本打算把一切都让给解开碑文之人。可是，直至今日此刻，谁都没能解开，我没被任何人继承吾之一切地来到了此处。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Avevo intenzione di lasciare tutto quanto alla persona che l'avesse risolto. {n}Ma ora siamo arrivati a questo punto, con nessuno che l'ha risolto, e che niente di me sia stato tramandato a nessuno.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Therefore, I am proclaiming here and now that I will suspend the use of the epitaph's riddle as a method of choosing my successor.
Umineko Project (UP): "Therefore. I am proclaiming here and now that I will suspend the use of the epitaph's riddle as a method of choosing my successor."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo

Umineko Project (UP): "This is not only something that can be said of the headship. It can also be said of money! A "rich person" doesn't mean someone who has money. It means someone who crushes everyone who has more money than himself, and who scrabbles together more money than anyone else."

Это понятие применимо к тому, кто сокрушает тех, у кого больше денег, чем у него, а затем набирает себе денег больше чем у кого‐либо."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): You three, who don't have that wild spirit, are as unfit for the succession as Krauss is!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "You three, who lack that wild spirit, are as unfit for the succession as Krauss!!"
PC Japanese (JP): その野生の精神がないお前たち３人に、蔵臼同様に継承の資格などありはしないッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その野生の精神がないお前たち３人に、蔵臼同様に継承の資格などありはしないッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Вы трое, не наделённые этим диким духом, так же как и Краусс не годитесь в наследники!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vocês três, que faltam com um espírito atroz, são inadequados, assim como Krauss, para obterem a sucessão!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒有這種野生精神的你們三人，與藏臼一樣，沒有繼承的資格！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没有这种野生精神的你们三人，与藏臼一样，没有继承的资格！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Voi tre, che non avete questo spirito selvaggio, siete inadatti alla successione quanto Krauss!!"

Steam (ST): Eva and the rest had no words to respond with. And they couldn't calculate what it was Kinzo was about to say...
Umineko Project (UP): Eva and the rest had no words to respond with. And they couldn't figure out what it was that Kinzo was about to say...
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽たちに返せる言葉はない。そして、金蔵が何を語ろうとしているのか、計りかねている…。
Russian (RU): Ева и остальные не нашли, что ответить. И они не могли просчитать, что собирался сказать Кинзо...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nem Eva nem nenhum deles tinha palavras para responder àquilo.{n}Eles nem sequer conseguiam entender sobre o que Kinzo estava falando...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽等人無話可還。而且也完全猜不出，金藏到底要說什麼…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽等人无话可还。而且也完全猜不出，金藏到底要说什么…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Eva e gli altri non avevano parole per rispondere. E non potevano pensare a cosa Kinzo stava per dire...

Steam (ST): Was Kinzo actually planning to proclaim that no one would succeed the Headship?
Umineko Project (UP): Was Kinzo actually planning to proclaim that no one would succeed the head?

Russian (RU): Намеревался ли Кинзо объявить, что никто не наследует главенство?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Estaria Kinzo, na verdade, planejando proclamar que nenhum deles sucederia a chefia da família?

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kinzo aveva in mente di proclamare che nessuno sarebbe succeduto a capofamiglia?

Steam (ST): If so, that would work to Eva, Rosa, and Rudolf's advantage.
Umineko Project (UP): If so, that would work to Eva, Rosa, and Rudolf's advantage.
PC Japanese (JP): もしそうならば、それは絵羽たちにとって利することになる。

Steam (ST): After all, in the end, they'd just have to renegotiate everything among the siblings after Kinzo's death, splitting the inheritance evenly.
Umineko Project (UP): Because the only thing the siblings would ultimately need to do is coordinate everything between them after Kinzo's death, and split the inheritance evenly.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sempre que falava sobre {f:5:Beatrice}, ele era eloquente e tomado pela obsessão......

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お前たちのような愚かなる息子たちなど、まさに白昼夢！！　初めからいなかったも同然よッ！！」

Umineko Project (UP): Nanjo nervously raised his hand, asking to speak.{n}Kinzo permitted it.

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Steam (ST): "I understand how you feel, Kinzo-san. Because you love your children, you expect a lot of them, and as a parent and grandparent myself, I understand how parental affection can make you feel as though your expectations were betrayed."
Umineko Project (UP): "I understand how you feel, Kinzo‐san. Because you love your children, you expect a lot of them, and as a parent and grandparent myself, I understand the parental affection that can make you feel as though these expectations were betrayed."
PC Japanese (JP): 「金蔵さんの気持ちもわかる。子どもたちを愛するがゆえに、大きな期待を寄せ、それゆえに期待を裏切られたような気持ちになる親心、同じく子どもや孫を持つ身として、よーくわかります。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「金蔵さんの気持ちもわかる。子どもたちを愛するがゆえに、大きな期待を寄せ、それゆえに期待を裏切られたような気持ちになる親心、同じく子どもや孫を持つ身として、よーくわかります」
Russian (RU): "Я понимаю, что вы чувствуете, Кинзо‐сан. Поскольку вы любите своих детей, вы многого ожидаете от них, и сам будучи родителем и дедом, я понимаю родительскую любовь, способную вызвать ощущение, что эти ожидания предали."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu entendo como você se sente, Kinzo‐san. Por causa de seu amor por seus filhos, você esperava muito deles, e sendo pai e avô também, eu entendo essa aflição parental que você passa quando sente que suas expectativas foram traídas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我理解金藏先生的心情。這份因為愛著孩子們，所以才對他們抱有了極大的期待，所以才感到期望被辜負了的父母心，身為同樣有子女孫兒的我，也是非——常地理解。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我理解金藏先生的心情。这份因为爱着孩子们，所以才对他们抱有了极大的期待，所以才感到期望被辜负了的父母心，身为同样有子女孙儿的我，也是非——常地理解。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Io capisco come ti senti, Kinzo-san. Dato che ami i tuoi figli, ti aspetti molto da loro, e come genitore e Nonno io stesso, capisco l'affetto che ti fa sembrare che le tue aspettative siano state tradite.

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Steam (ST): "...However, you are extraordinary, Kinzo-san. A genius. Isn't saying that it's only natural for them to catch up to you a little too harsh...?
Umineko Project (UP): "......However, you are extraordinary, Kinzo‐san. A genius. Isn't it a little too harsh to say that it's only natural for them to catch up to you...?"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……しかし、金蔵さんは非凡だ。天才だ。そんな金蔵さんに追い付いて当然と言うんでは、ちょいと酷過ぎるんじゃないかね…？」
Russian (RU): "......Однако вы крайне незаурядный человек. Гений. Не кажется ли вам, что ваши слова о том, что для них естественно достигнуть вашего уровня, слишком резки?"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, tu sei straordinario, Kinzo-san. Un genio. Dire che è solo naturale per loro raggiungere il tuo livello non è forse un po' troppo duro...?

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E mesmo assim, isso não os impediu de tentarem — o Krauss‐san, a Eva‐san, o Rudolf‐san, a Rosa‐san, e todos seus cônjuges estão dando tudo de si para se igualar a você..."

Steam (ST): "Hohoooooooooohhh??? And just how much money have they built up with this "Doing their best"? After these cowards fail completely in ventures and gain debt, and still try to sponge off me, how can you say that they did their very best...?!!"

После того, как эти трусы потерпели полный крах в своих финансовых делах и теперь в долгах как в шелках, но при этом всё ещё пытаются вытянуть из меня деньги, как ты можешь говорить, что они старались изо всех сил?!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hohoooooooooohhh??? E quanto dinheiro eles obtiveram "dando tudo de si"? Aqueles débeis, que falharam com cada uma de suas empresas e se afundaram em dívidas, e agora tentam sugar tudo de mim, estão "dando tudo de si"? Como estão fazendo issoooo...?!?!"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hohoooooooooohhh??? E quanto denaro hanno accumulato con questo ‘fare del loro meglio’? Dopo che questi codardi hanno fallito in iniziative e ottenuto debiti, e provato ancora a vivere sulle mie spalle, come puoi dire che hanno fatto del loro meglio...?!!

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Money is the crystallization of everything in this world. If you cannot grasp that, then you cannot grasp the world! If a life cannot strongly grasp this world, it doesn't deserve to live!! Disappear!! Disappear from my life and reality!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Money is the crystallization of everything in this world. If you cannot grasp that, then you cannot grasp the world! If a soul cannot keep a tight grasp on this world, it doesn't deserve to live!! Disappear!! Begone from my life and reality!!"
PC Japanese (JP): この世の全てはカネとして結晶しているのだ。それが掴めぬということは、この世を掴んでおらぬということ！　魂がこの世をしっかり掴んでおらぬということは、生きるに値せぬということだッ！！　消えろ！！　我が生と現実から消え去ってしまえ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「この世の全てはカネとして結晶しているのだ。それが掴めぬということは、この世を掴んでおらぬということ！　魂がこの世をしっかり掴んでおらぬということは、生きるに値せぬということだッ！！　消えろ！！　我が生と現実から消え去ってしまえ！！」
Russian (RU): "Деньги являются кристаллизацией всего в этом мире. Если ты не способен ухватить это, то не способен ухватить и мир! А если не способен как следует ухватить этот мир — ты не заслуживаешь жить! Исчезните! Исчезните из моей жизни и реальности!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Dinheiro é a cristalização de tudo neste mundo. Se não é capaz de obtê‐lo, então não será capaz de obter o mundo! Se uma alma não é capaz de se manter firmemente neste mundo, ela não merece viver!! Desapareçam!! Sumam de minha vida, sumam da minha realidade!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這個世界上的一切都結晶成了錢。抓不住錢，就是抓不住這個世界！靈魂沒有牢牢抓住這個世界，就代表著沒有活下去的價值！！消失吧！！與吾之生一起於現實中消失吧！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这个世界上的一切都结晶成了钱。抓不住钱，就是抓不住这个世界！灵魂没有牢牢抓住这个世界，就代表着没有活下去的价值！！消失吧！！与吾之生一起于现实中消失吧！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il denaro è la cristallizzazione di tutto in questo mondo. Se non lo si comprende, non si può comprendere il mondo! Se una vita non può comprendere fortemente questo mondo, non merita di vivere!! Sparite!! Sparite dalla mia vita e realtà!!"

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Steam (ST): "...That's a reckless argument. With that logic, even I must not live.
Umineko Project (UP): "......That argument is unreasonable. With that logic, even I would not be allowed to live."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……それは暴論です。その理論から言ったら、私だって生きていてはいけないことになる」

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Steam (ST): ...Even so, I believe the time I spend playing chess with you was worthwhile for both of us, Kinzo-san... ...You should know better than anyone else that there are many things in this world that cannot be bought with money."
Umineko Project (UP): "......And yet I believe the time I spent playing chess with you was worthwhile for both of us... ......You should know better than anyone else that there are many things in this world that money cannot buy."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そんな私でも、金蔵さんと過ごしたチェスの時間は、共に価値あるものだったと信じていますぞ…。……世の中、お金で買えないものもたくさんあることを、金蔵さん自身が誰よりもご存知のはずだ」
Russian (RU): "......И тем не менее я полагаю, что время, проведенное мною с вами за игрой в шахматы принесло пользу нам обоим, Кинзо‐сан.........Вы лучше чем кто‐либо должны знать, что в этом мире существует множество вещей, которые нельзя купить за деньги."

Umineko Project (UP): "But besides money, they have also built up a great many things that money can't buy. When it comes to that, they are in no way inferior to you."

Steam (ST): "Hoh. And what do you claim they have built up that cannot be bought with money?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Hoh. And what are you saying they have built up that money cannot buy?"

Umineko Project (UP): Was he talking about starting a strange ritual involving {f:5:Beatrice}'s resurrection again......?

Steam (ST): In the past, he had carried out many eccentricities that he called by the same name, such as starting to burn a strange incense and filling the whole mansion with the stench.
Umineko Project (UP): In the past, he had carried out many eccentricities that he called by the same name, such as lighting a strange incense and filling the whole mansion with the stench.

Russian (RU): В прошлом он совершал всякие эксцентричные поступки, называя их этим словом, например, жег странные ароматические палочки, вонь от которых разносилась по всему особняку.

Steam (ST): To the siblings, a ceremony was nothing more than one of the aged Kinzo's obnoxious hobbies.

Umineko Project (UP): "The ritual as I inscribed it in the epitaph. ......It is a ritual to revive {f:5:Beatrice}, and open the door to the Golden Land."

Russian (RU): "Будет проводиться ритуал, описанный в моей эпитафии. ......Ритуал по воскрешению {f:5:Беатриче} и открытию дороги в Золотую Землю."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): That witch, who escaped her cage of flesh and sneeringly slipped through my fingers, I shall now capture... and force into submission with my greatest hidden art. ......For that purpose, I must offer 13 people as sacrifices."
Umineko Project (UP): "That witch, who escaped her cage of flesh and sneeringly slipped through my fingers, I will finally be able to capture, and subjugate, with my greatest hidden art. .........Only, I must sacrifice thirteen people for that purpose."
PC Japanese (JP): 肉体の檻を逃れ、私の指の隙間を嘲笑うようにすり抜けるあの魔女を、今度こそ捕らえ、屈服させる、私の最大の秘術だ。………そのために、１３人もの命を生贄に捧げねばならぬがな。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「肉体の檻を逃れ、私の指の隙間を嘲笑うようにすり抜けるあの魔女を、今度こそ捕らえ、屈服させる、私の最大の秘術だ。………そのために、１３人もの命を生贄に捧げねばならぬがな」
Russian (RU): "Теперь я поймаю эту ведьму, сбежавшую из клетки плоти и насмешливо проскользнувшую сквозь мои пальцы, и заставлю её сдаться при помощи моего величайшего тайного искусства. .........Для этой цели я должен принести 13 человек в жертву."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Finalmente serei capaz de capturar aquela bruxa, que fugiu de sua gaiola de carne e, arrogantemente, escapou através de meus dedos, e subjugá‐la, com minha grande técnica secreta. .........Para este fim, eu devo sacrificar treze pessoas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「此為今次定要捉住，逃出肉體的牢籠，如嘲笑般地鑽出我指間縫隙的那位魔女，令其屈服的，吾之最大的秘術。………為此，我必須將十三人的性命獻為活祭。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「此为今次定要捉住，逃出肉体的牢笼，如嘲笑般地钻出我指间缝隙的那位魔女，令其屈服的，吾之最大的秘术。………为此，我必须将十三人的性命献为活祭。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quella strega, che è scappata dalla sua prigione di carne e deridendomi è scivolata via dalle mie dita, io ora la catturerò, e la farò arrendere con la mia più grande arte nascosta. ... Per questo scopo, devo offrire 13 persone come sacrificio.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "...Hehheheheheh! Gathering 13 people's worth of sacrifices is no easy feat. But tonight is the family conference! Many adults have gathered on Rokkenjima. There could be no other day on which to carry out this ceremony."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Hehheheheheh! It is not easy to gather thirteen sacrifices. But tonight is the family conference! Look how many have gathered on Rokkenjima. There could be no other day on which to carry out this ritual."
PC Japanese (JP): ……ふっふふふふふ！　１３人もの生贄は容易には集まらぬ。しかし、今宵は親族会議！　これだけの大人数が六軒島に集まった。この儀式が行なえるのは、今日をおいて他にないのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ふっふふふふふ！　１３人もの生贄は容易には集まらぬ。しかし、今宵は親族会議！　これだけの大人数が六軒島に集まった。この儀式が行なえるのは、今日をおいて他にないのだ」
Russian (RU): "......Хе‐хе‐хе‐хе! Собрать 13 человек для принесения в жертву — нелёгкая задача. Но сегодня собрание семьи! На Роккенджиме собралось много взрослых людей. Другого дня для проведения этой ритуала и не подобрать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Hehheheheheh! Não é fácil reunir treze sacrifícios. Mas esta noite é a conferência familiar! Vejam quantos eu reuni em Rokkenjima. Não poderia haver dia melhor para conduzir este ritual."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……哼、哼哼哼哼哼！要集齊十三名活祭可不容易。不過，今宵是親族會議！有這麼多的人聚集在六軒島。執行儀式非今日莫屬。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……哼、哼哼哼哼哼！要集齐十三名活祭可不容易。不过，今宵是亲族会议！有这么多的人聚集在六轩岛。执行仪式非今日莫属。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Hehheheheheh! Non è facile riunire 13 persone che valgano come sacrifici. Ma stanotte è la conferenza di famiglia! Molti adulti si sono riuniti su Rokkenjima. Non potrebbe esserci altro giorno per svolgere questa cerimonia."

Steam (ST): Taken literally, it sounded like he was telling them to become human sacrifices for his dark ceremony and die.
Umineko Project (UP): Taken literally, it could only sound as though he was telling them to die as sacrifices for his disturbing ritual.

Steam (ST): Ridiculous. Was it some kind of metaphor...?
Umineko Project (UP): Ridiculous. Was this some kind of metaphor...?

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ridicolo. È un qualche tipo di metafora...?

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "What is it you don't understand? I am making this extremely simple. I told you that I'll choose 13 of the humans on this island and offer them as sacrifices in a ceremony to revive {f:5:Beatrice}.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「何がわかりかねるというのか。私は至極単純に話している。ベアトリーチェを蘇らせる儀式のために、この島にいる人間から１３人を選び、生贄に捧げようと言っている」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Cos'è che non capisci? Sto parlando in modo estremamente semplice. Ho detto che sceglierò 13 persone tra gli umani di quest'isola e li offrirò come sacrifici nella cerimonia per resuscitare Beatrice.

Russian (RU): "Даже такие никчёмные люди вроде вас могут очень пригодиться в качестве жертв на этом ритуале. Вах‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха!!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "...Listen!! This is not a joke nor anything of the sort. This is my final bet, my final ceremony, the last one I will desire in my life!
Umineko Project (UP): "......Hear this!! This is not a joke nor anything of the sort. This is my final bet, my final ritual, the last I will desire in my life!"
PC Japanese (JP): ……聞けッ！！　これは冗談でも何でもない。私が人生の最後に欲する、最後の賭け、最後の儀式である！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……聞けッ！！　これは冗談でも何でもない。我が人生の最後に欲する、最後の賭け、最後の儀式である！」
Russian (RU): "......Слушайте внимательно! Это никакая не шутка или розыгрыш. Это моя последняя ставка, мой окончательный ритуал, последний который я желаю в своей жизни!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ouçam‐me!! Isto não é uma piada nem nada do gênero. Esta é minha aposta final, meu último ritual, o último que ansiarei em vida!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……聽好！！這不是什麼開玩笑。此乃我在人生的最後所想要做的，最後的賭博、最後的儀式！」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ascoltate!! Questo non è uno scherzo o qualcosa di simile. Questa è la mia scommessa finale, l'ultima che desidero nella mia vita!

Umineko Project (UP): "There are now more than thirteen humans on this island. In short, that's a head count which can easily satisfy this massive number of sacrifices! Become the sacrifices for my ritual!!"
PC Japanese (JP): この島には今、１３人を超える人間がいる。つまり、この膨大な数の生贄を容易に満たせるだけの頭数が存在するというわけだ！　お前たちは我が儀式の生贄となれッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「この島には今、１３人を超える人間がいる。つまり、この膨大な数の生贄を容易に満たせるだけの頭数が存在するというわけだ！　お前たちは我が儀式の生贄となれッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Сейчас на острове находится больше 13 человек. Короче, это число голов идеально подходит для огромного количества жертв! Станьте жертвами на моём ритуале!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Há agora mais de treze humanos nesta ilha. Simplificando, é uma contagem de cabeças que pode facilmente satisfazer o massivo número de sacrifícios!{n}Tornem‐se sacrifícios para o meu ritual!!"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ora ci sono più di 13 umani su quest'isola. In breve, è un numero che può facilmente soddisfare il vasto numero di sacrifici! Diventate sacrifici per la mia cerimonia!!"

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa

Umineko Project (UP): Unusually for Nanjo, his face changed color and he stood up and shouted.

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed this wasn't the first time Nanjo had heard all this dark talk about thirteen sacrifices.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que esta não era a primeira vez que Nanjo ouvia sobre este conto sombrio envolvendo treze sacrifícios.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 看来，这些关于十三名活祭的令人不安的话，南条并非头一次听到。

Umineko Project (UP): "Sorry, my friend. That was not a joke nor anything of the sort. It is what I bet my life on, the final ritual, the final game that I will challenge."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「すまんな、我が友よ。あれは冗談でも何でもない。我が生涯を賭して、最後に挑む儀式であり、ゲームなのだよ」
