Chinese Traditional (CHT): 躺著六具慘死屍體的餐廳被紅色的淒慘裝飾搞得骯髒狼籍……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 躺着六具惨死尸体的餐厅被红色的凄惨装饰搞得肮脏狼籍……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sei cadaveri brutalmente assassinati giacciono nella sala da pranzo, che era contaminata con rosse, macabre decorazioni...

Steam (ST): It was now unimaginable that, until just a second ago, 13 humans had been arranged here in a well-organized manner.
Umineko Project (UP): By now, it was impossible to imagine that thirteen people had been sitting here in an orderly manner just moments ago.
PC Japanese (JP): そこについさっきまで、１３人もの人間が整然と座っていたなど、もはや想像することも出来ない。
Russian (RU): Было практически невозможно представить, что совсем недавно здесь организованно расположились 13 человек.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora, é impossível imaginar que até pouco tempo atrás treze pessoas estavam sentadas ordenadamente aqui.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 直到剛才還整然坐著十三名人類的情景，已經無從想像。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 直到刚才还整然坐着十三名人类的情景，已经无从想象。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era immaginabile ora che, fino a pochi secondi fa, 13 umani erano lì disposti in un modo ben organizzato.

Steam (ST): Kinzo lined up the famous demons and their subordinates, loudly declared the beginning of a night of overwhelming mass murders, and swore to himself that he would certainly revive {f:5:Beatrice} and open the door to the Golden Land...
Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo lined up the demons of renown and their subordinates, loudly declared the beginning of an overwhelming night of mass murder, and swore to himself that he would certainly revive {f:5:Beatrice}, and open the door to the Golden Land......
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は、名だたる悪魔とその配下たちを並べ、圧倒的なる虐殺の夜の幕開けを高らかに宣言し、必ずやベアトリーチェを蘇らせ、黄金郷の扉を開くことを自らに誓うのだった……。
Russian (RU): Кинзо выстроил в ряд знаменитых демонов и их подчиненных, громко огласил начало сокрушительной ночи массовых убийств, и поклялся, что непременно воскресит {f:5:Беатриче} и откроет дверь в Золотую Землю...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo alinhou os demônios de renome e seus subordinados e, de forma ruidosa, declarou o início de uma opressiva noite de assassinatos em massa, jurando a si mesmo que ele, indubitavelmente, iria reviver {f:5:Beatrice} e abrir a porta para a Terra Dourada......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏命令著名惡魔及其部下整列，高聲宣言壓倒性虐殺之夜的開幕，向自己發誓，一定要令貝阿朵莉切復甦，打開黃金鄉之門……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏命令著名恶魔及其部下整列，高声宣言压倒性虐杀之夜的开幕，向自己发誓，一定要令贝阿朵莉切复苏，打开黄金乡之门……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kinzo mise in fila i famosi demoni e i suoi subordinati, dichiarando ad alta voce l'inizio di una notte di travolgenti omicidi di massa, e giurò a se stesso che avrebbe certamente riportato in vita Beatrice, e aperto la porta per la Terra Dorata...

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Sorry to keep you waiting!! Now the curtain finally rises on the first twilight!! *cackle*! That Kinzo, I see he loves being flashy as usual. So, even that man who can be more persistent than anything when he follows you around...can shine so when on the stage."
Umineko Project (UP): "The wait is over!! At last the curtain rises on the first twilight!! *cackle*! That Kinzo, as usual, he loves being flashy. Who knew that this man, who can be more persistent than anything when he follows you around, could shine so when placed on the stage."
PC Japanese (JP): 「待たせたなァ！！　これにて第一の晩、いよいよ開幕、開幕ゥ！！くっくっく！　金蔵め、相変わらず派手を好む男よ。付きまとわれればしつこいことこの上なき男も、舞台の上ではこれほどまでに映えるというのか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「待たせたなァ！！　これにて第一の晩、いよいよ開幕、開幕ゥ！！　くっくっく！　金蔵め、相変わらず派手を好む男よ。付きまとわれればしつこいことこの上なき男も、舞台の上ではこれほどまでに映えるというのか」
Russian (RU): "Извините, что заставила ждать! Занавес первых сумерек наконец‐то поднят! *хи‐хи*! Этот Кинзо просто обожает покрасоваться. Выходит, этот мужчина, который может быть назойливее всех на свете, вечно следуя за тобой по пятам, способен так великолепно сиять на сцене."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A espera acabou!! Vamos abrir as cortinas do primeiro crepúsculo!! *gargalhada*! Maldito Kinzo, como sempre, ele adora escândalos. Quem diria que aquele homem, capaz de ser mais persistente que qualquer coisa quando fica te perseguindo, poderia brilhar assim, quando posicionado no centro do palco."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「久等了！！這下第一晚終於是開幕、開幕了！！呵呵呵！死金藏，依舊是個喜好花里胡哨的男人呢。這個一纏上人就死纏爛打到無以復加的男人，也是能在舞台之上如此上鏡的嘛。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「久等了！！这下第一晚终于是开幕、开幕了！！呵呵呵！死金藏，依旧是个喜好花里胡哨的男人呢。这个一缠上人就死缠烂打到无以复加的男人，也是能在舞台之上如此上镜的嘛。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Scusate per avervi fatto aspettare!! Ora il sipario si è finalmente alzato sul primo crepuscolo!! *cackle*! Quel Kinzo, ama mettersi in mostra come suo solito. Quindi, quell'uomo che può essere più persistente di ogni altro quando ti segue ovunque, può risplendere in tal modo quando è sul palco."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Damn... Always killing in a grotesque way, as usual... Smashing half of their heads?! The bad taste you witches and demons have always pisses me off...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Dammit...... Always killing them in a gory way...... Destroying half of their heads?! The sick shit you witches and demons pull never fails to piss me off...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「くそ……。相変わらずグロい殺し方ばかりしやがって……。頭部半壊だぁ？！　てめぇら魔女ども悪魔どもの悪趣味には相変わらずウンザリさせられるぜ…！」
Russian (RU): "Чёрт... Ты как обычно убиваешь отвратными способами... Разнести полголовы?! Дурной вкус у вас, демонов и ведьм, не перестает выводить меня из себя!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Merda...... Sempre matando eles de forma grotesca...... Destruindo metade de suas cabeças?! Esses gostos doentios de vocês nunca falham em me deixar puto...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「可惡……。依舊盡是用這種血腥的殺法……。頭部半毀？！你們魔女惡魔的低級趣味依舊是令人煩得冒火…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「可恶……。依旧尽是用这种血腥的杀法……。头部半毁？！你们魔女恶魔的低级趣味依旧是令人烦得冒火…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Maledetta... sempre uccidendo in un modo grottesco, come al solito... Distruggere metà delle loro teste?! Il cattivo gusto che avete voi streghe e demoni mi ha sempre dato fastidio...!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Smashing half of their heads... I see. So, she's realized that, in the games up until now, that's been the most ideal method of killing."
Umineko Project (UP): "Destroying half of their heads...... I see. So she noticed that the most ideal method of killing, in all the games up until now, was this one."
PC Japanese (JP): 「頭部半壊……、なるほど。これまでのゲームで、一番理想的な殺し方がこれだと気付いたわけね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「頭部半壊……、なるほど。これまでのゲームで、一番理想的な殺し方がこれだと気付いたわけね」
Russian (RU): "Разнести полголовы... Понятно. Значит, по прошлым играм она заметила, что это самый идеальный метод убийства."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Destruir metade de suas cabeças...... Entendo. Então ela percebeu que o método ideal de matar, em todos os jogos até agora, é este."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「頭部半毀……，原來如此。魔女是通過以往的對局察覺到了，這是最為理想的殺法了呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「头部半毁……，原来如此。魔女是通过以往的对局察觉到了，这是最为理想的杀法了呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Distruggere metà delle loro teste... capisco. Quindi se ne è accorta, nei giochi fino ad ora, che è il metodo ideale di uccidere."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Ideal? How is such a grotesque way of killing ideal?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Ideal? How the crap is this grotesque way of killing ideal?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「理想的？　このグロい殺し方がどう理想的だってんだ？！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「理想的？　このひでぇ殺し方がどう理想的だってんだ？！」
Russian (RU): "Идеальный? И чем же идеален этот противный метод убийства?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ideal? Como essa merda doentia é a forma ideal de matar?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「理想的？這種血腥的殺法，怎麼理想了？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「理想的？这种血腥的杀法，怎么理想了？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ideale? Come può essere ideale un modo così grottesco di uccidere?!"

Speaker: Gaap
Steam (ST): "...Isn't it though? Try and remember the very first game."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It's very much ideal. Try and remember the very first game."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……実に理想的じゃない。一番最初のゲームを思い出してみるといい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……実に理想的じゃない。一番最初のゲームを思い出してみるといい」
Russian (RU): "......Ну разве он и впрямь не идеален? Попробуй вспомнить самую первую игру."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Não é esta a idealização máxima? Tente‐se lembrar do primeiro jogo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……確實很理想吧。你去回憶下最早的第一盤遊戲好了呀。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……确实很理想吧。你去回忆下最早的第一盘游戏好了呀。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Non è forse veramente l'ideale? Prova a ricordare il primo gioco all'inizio."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "You...! So, you're that new demon or whatever that just appeared... Damn, so does this mean that the witch's corrosion continued, and there are now even more creeps wandering around...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "You......! So you're that new demon or whatever that just appeared... Goddammit, so the witch's corrosion advanced, and now there are even more unsavory characters...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「お前は……！　さっき登場しやがった、新しい悪魔とかいうヤツか…。くそ、また魔女の侵食が進んで、ロクでもないヤツが増えたというわけなのか…？！」
Russian (RU): "Ты!.. Так ты и есть тот недавно возникший демон или как тебя там... Блин, это означает, что коррозия ведьмы продолжилась и сомнительных личностей только прибавилось?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você......! Então você é aquele novo demônio, ou o que quer que seja, que acabou de aparecer...? Merda, quer dizer que a corrosão da bruxa avançou e agora temos ainda mais personagens desagradáveis...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你是……！剛才登場的新惡魔什麼什麼的傢伙嘛…。可惡，魔女的侵蝕又更進一步，又多了新的不上道的傢伙嗎…？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你是……！刚才登场的新恶魔什么什么的家伙嘛…。可恶，魔女的侵蚀又更进一步，又多了新的不上道的家伙吗…？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Tu...! Così, tu sei il nuovo demone o quella roba lì che è appena apparsa... Merda, significa che la corrosione della strega è proseguita e ora ci sono persino più personaggi disgustosi...?!"

Steam (ST): ...The more the witch's corrosion advances, the more Rokkenjima tilts towards the spirit world.
Umineko Project (UP): ......The more the witch's corrosion progresses, the more Rokkenjima tilts towards the other world.
PC Japanese (JP): ……魔女の侵食が進めば進むほどに、六軒島は異界側に傾いていく。
Russian (RU): ......Чем дальше продвигается коррозия ведьмы, тем больше Роккенджима склоняется в сторону мира духов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quanto mais a corrosão da bruxa progride, mas Rokkenjima pende para o {i:outro mundo}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……魔女的侵蝕越是推進，六軒島就越是傾向於異界。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……魔女的侵蚀越是推进，六轩岛就越是倾向于异界。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Più la corrosione della strega avanza, più Rokkenjima pende verso il mondo spirituale.

Steam (ST): That's why strange, insane people keep appearing one by one.
Umineko Project (UP): That's why strange people keep appearing one by one.
PC Japanese (JP): 次々とおかしな、そして狂ったヤツらが増えていくというわけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 次々とおかしなヤツらが増えていくというわけだ。
Russian (RU): Вот почему странные, безумные личности продолжили появляться одна за другой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É por isso que não para de aparecer mais gente estranha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，古怪的傢伙一個接一個地增加。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，古怪的家伙一个接一个地增加。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È per questo che gente strana e folle ha continuato ad apparire in continuazione.

Steam (ST): This island has been closed off by the typhoon, so no Human can leave it, much less appear as a new character to increase their numbers.
Umineko Project (UP): This island is closed off by the typhoon, and not only can no {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s leave it, but new {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s can't appear either.
PC Japanese (JP): この島は台風に閉ざされ、ニンゲンは島から出ることはもちろん、新しく増えて登場することも出来ない。
Russian (RU): Поскольку этот остров оказался отрезан тайфуном от окружающего мира, и никто из {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}ей не мог покинуть его, новые {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}и, разумеется, тоже не могли появиться на нём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A ilha está isolada pelo tufão, e além dos {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} não poderem deixá‐la, novos {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} também não podem aparecer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個島被台風所封閉，就人類而言，無法離開島一事自不必說，新增人類登場也是不可能的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个岛被台风所封闭，就人类而言，无法离开岛一事自不必说，新增人类登场也是不可能的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che quest'isola è isolata dal tifone e nessuno umano può lasciarla, ovviamente non possono apparire nuovi esseri umani.

Steam (ST): But the more the corrosion advances, the more witches and demons can appear, without limit. Increasing one by one.
Umineko Project (UP): But the more the corrosion progresses, the more witches and demons can appear, without limit. Increasing one by one.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし魔女や悪魔どもは、侵食されればされるほどに、いくらでも登場できる。次々に増えていく。
Russian (RU): Но чем дальше заходит коррозия, тем больше ведьм и демонов возникает без всяких ограничений. Увеличиваясь в количестве одна за другой и один за другим.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas quanto mais a corrosão progride, maior é o número de bruxas e demônios que podem aparecer, sem quaisquer limites. Aumentando um a um.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，魔女與惡魔卻可以視侵蝕程度，沒完沒了地登場。越來越多。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，魔女与恶魔却可以视侵蚀程度，没完没了地登场。越来越多。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma più la corrosione avanza, più streghe e demoni possono apparire, senza limiti. Aumentando uno ad uno.

Steam (ST): By now, there might be more demons than Humans among the characters appearing in this insane tale. ...Their numbers might be the thing that represents this mad corrosion.
Umineko Project (UP): By now, perhaps there are more demons than {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s among the characters appearing in this insane tale. ......Their numbers might be precisely the figure representing this mad corrosion.
PC Japanese (JP): 今やこの狂った物語の登場人物は、ニンゲンより悪魔の方が多いのではないだろうか。……ヤツらの人数こそが、その狂いの侵食を示す数字そのものかもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 今やこのおかしな物語の登場人物は、ニンゲンより悪魔の方が多いのではないだろうか。……ヤツらの人数こそが、その歪みの侵食を示す数字そのものかもしれない。
Russian (RU): На данный момент, среди персонажей этой безумной истории демонов может насчитываться больше, чем {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}ей. ......Их число наверняка и является показателем уровня коррозии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Neste momento, possivelmente há mais demônios do que {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} entre os personagens deste insano conto. ......Seus números certamente representam bem o estado dessa corrosão distorcida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 現如今，這個瘋狂故事的登場人物中，比起人類，會不會還是惡魔要更多呢？……他們的人數即是表示這個瘋狂的侵蝕度的數字，也說不定。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 现如今，这个疯狂故事的登场人物中，比起人类，会不会还是恶魔要更多呢？……他们的人数即是表示这个疯狂的侵蚀度的数字，也说不定。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ora come ora, probabilmente ci sono più demoni che umani tra i personaggi che stanno comparendo in questa folle storia. ... Il loro numero può essere ciò che rappresenta questa pazzesca corrosione.

Steam (ST): Yeah, I'm sure that's true. And the corrosion hasn't just affected the number of people, but apparently their fashion sense as well.
Umineko Project (UP): Yeah, I'm sure that's true. And not only are their numbers being affected by the corrosion, their fashion sense apparently is as well.
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、きっとそうだろうな。そしてどうやら、侵食されてるのは人数だけじゃなく、服装センスもらしいぜ。
Russian (RU): Да, уверен, что это так. И мало того, что люди числом уступают, так ещё и у неё вкусы в одежде оставляют желать самого лучшего.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, tenho certeza que é isso. E não são apenas os números que estão sendo afetados pela corrosão, mas também seus sensos estéticos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊——，一定是如此。而且，看來受侵蝕的並不僅僅是人數，服裝的品味也受到了侵蝕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊——，一定是如此。而且，看来受侵蚀的并不仅仅是人数，服装的品味也受到了侵蚀。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Già, sono sicuro sia così. E non solo il numero delle persone è corroso, ma pure il suo senso della moda sembra esserlo.

Steam (ST): If the corrosion advances any further and even more weird people appear, just what in the world will they be wearing? ......It's so scary I can't imagine...
Umineko Project (UP): If the corrosion advances any further and even more weird people appear, just what in the world will they be wearing? .........It's too scary for me to imagine...
PC Japanese (JP): これ以上、侵食が進んでさらにおかしいヤツらが登場したなら、一体、どんな格好になるんだろうな。………俺ぁ、おっかなくて想像も出来ねぇぜ…。
Russian (RU): Если коррозия распространится и дальше, и появится ещё больше странных людей, то мне страшно представить, что они на себя напялят. .........Это так жутко, что я и представить себе не могу...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se a corrosão avançar ainda mais, e mais pessoas estranhas aparecerem, imagina que merda elas vão estar vestindo? .........É tão assustador que sequer consigo imaginar...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 侵蝕再推進下去，再有別的稀奇古怪的傢伙登場的話，那他們會穿成什麼樣呢？………我啊，怕得連想都不敢想了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 侵蚀再推进下去，再有别的稀奇古怪的家伙登场的话，那他们会穿成什么样呢？………我啊，怕得连想都不敢想了…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se la corrosione avanza ancora e dovessero apparire ancora più persone strane, che cosa diavolo indosserebbero? ... È così spaventoso che non riesco ad immaginarlo...

Steam (ST): ...Aaaah, seriously, give me a break... Don't make these weird guys increase in number anymore...!!

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Serial murder mystery novels that occur in places isolated from the outside world, like Rokkenjima is now, are sometimes called closed circles. Since such a place is isolated from the outside, it's like a circle that's closed. ...Therefore, in general, the characters and suspects are limited in number."
Umineko Project (UP): "Serial murder mystery novels that occur in places isolated from the outside world, like Rokkenjima is now, are sometimes called closed circles. Steam (ST): "When this game is over, I'll be sure to do that. *cackle*cackle*!"
Umineko Project (UP): "When this game is over, I'll be sure to do that. *cackle*cackle*!"

Speaker: Gaap
Steam (ST): "......Still, your two opponents are pretty cute, Riiche." "It looks like this kid has figured out the meaning of the corpses with their heads half smashed. ......Know what that is, girl...?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Still, your two opponents are pretty cute, Riiche. I'll bet this kid has figured out the meaning of the corpses with their heads half smashed. .........Do you get it, girl......?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………それにしても。リーチェの対戦相手のお二人はなかなか可愛いわ。この子なら、頭部半壊死体にどういう意味があるか、察しが付きそうね。………わかるぅ、お嬢ちゃん……？」
Russian (RU): ".........И всё‐таки какие у тебя симпатичные оппоненты, Риче. Судя по всему, девочка просекла, зачем разносить жертвам лишь половину лица. .........Ведь поняла, девочка?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Mesmo assim, seus oponentes são mesmo fofos, Riiche. Eu aposto que essa criança já descobriu o significado dos cadáveres com as cabeças parcialmente esmagadas. .........Não entendeu, garotinha......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………話說回來。莉～切的兩個對局敵手，都頗為可愛呢。這孩子的話，也許是能察覺到，頭部半毀的屍體是有著什麼意義的哦。………想明白了沒，小妹妹……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………话说回来。莉～切的两个对局敌手，都颇为可爱呢。这孩子的话，也许是能察觉到，头部半毁的尸体是有着什么意义的哦。………想明白了没，小妹妹……？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Comunque, i tuoi due avversari sono piuttosto carini, Riiche. Sembra che questa ragazza abbia capito il significato dei cadaveri con la loro testa mezza distrutta. ... Capiiito, ragazza...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Just now, she told me to remember the first game. ...What did that mean...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......Just now, she told me to remember the first game. ......What did that mean...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……さっきこいつは、一番最初のゲームを思い出せと言ったな。……どういう意味だ…？」
Russian (RU): "......Совсем недавно она посоветовала мне припомнить первую игру. ......Что она имела в виду?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Agora pouco, ela me disse para lembrar do primeiro jogo. ......O que ela quis dizer...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……剛才那傢伙說了，去回憶下最早的第一盤遊戲。……這話是什麼意思…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……刚才那家伙说了，去回忆下最早的第一盘游戏。……这话是什么意思…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Proprio ora, mi ha detto di ricordare il primo gioco. ... Che cosa significa...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Just what it sounds like. ...Remember the first twilight of the very first game. ...When the adults' corpses were found in the gardening shed with the magic circle drawn on it. Remember?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Just what it sounds like. ......Remember the first twilight of the very first game. ......When the adults' corpses were found in the gardening shed with the magic circle drawn on it. Remember?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「言葉通りの意味よ。……一番最初のゲームの第一の晩を思い出して。……大人たちの死体が魔法陣の描かれた園芸倉庫の中で発見された時のことよ。覚えてる？」
Russian (RU): "Именно то, что сказала. ......Помнишь первые сумерки самой первой игры. ......Когда трупы взрослых нашли на садовом складе, на двери которого был нарисован магический круг. Помнишь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Exatamente o que significa. ......Lembre‐se do primeiro crepúsculo do primeiro jogo. ......Quando os corpos dos adultos foram encontrados no depósito do jardim, com aquele círculo mágico desenhado. Lembra?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「字面意思喲。……回憶一下最早的第一盤遊戲的第一晚吧。……在畫著魔法陣的園藝倉庫中發現大人們屍體時的情景。還記得不？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「字面意思哟。……回忆一下最早的第一盘游戏的第一晚吧。……在画着魔法阵的园艺仓库中发现大人们尸体时的情景。还记得不？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Proprio quello che sembra. ... Rammenta il primo crepuscolo proprio del primo gioco. ... Quando i cadaveri degli adulti furono trovati nel capanno del giardino con un cerchio magico disegnato su di esso. Ricordi?"

Steam (ST): Episode 1. The first twilight.
Umineko Project (UP): Episode 1. The first twilight.
PC Japanese (JP): エピソード１。第一の晩。

Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Steam (ST): Krauss, Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa, Shannon, and Gohda... All six of them had their heads pulverized and died......
Umineko Project (UP): Six people—Krauss, Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa, Shannon, and Gohda—had died, and each of them had had their head pulverized.........
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼、留弗夫、霧江、楼座、紗音、郷田の６人が、それぞれに頭部を粉砕されて死亡していた………。
Russian (RU): Шесть человек: Краусс, Рудольф, Кирие, Роза, Шаннон и Года — у всех размозжили головы, отчего те и умерли...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seis pessoas — Krauss, Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa, Shannon e Gohda — morreram, e cada um deles teve suas cabeças destruídas.........
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 藏臼、留弗夫、霧江、樓座、紗音、鄉田六人，分別被搗碎頭部，死亡………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 藏臼、留弗夫、雾江、楼座、纱音、乡田六人，分别被捣碎头部，死亡………。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sei persone: Krauss, Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa, Shannon, e Gohda avevano ognuno la loro testa polverizzata ed erano morti...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "At that time, there were two types of corpses. Some had their faces pulverized, and some had half of their faces pulverized."
Umineko Project (UP): "At that time, there were two types of corpses. The ones with their faces pulverized, and the ones with half of their faces pulverized."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あの時、あそこには２種類の死体があったわ。それは、顔面を粉砕された死体と、側面を粉砕された死体の２種類。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あの時、あそこには２種類の死体があったわ。それは、顔面を粉砕された死体と、側面を粉砕された死体の２種類」
Russian (RU): "Тогда имелось два типа трупов. У одних обезображено всё лицо, у других половина."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Naquele momento, haviam dois tipos de cadáveres. Aqueles com os rostos completamente destruídos, e aqueles com parte de seus rostos destruídos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那時，現場出現了兩種屍體。一種是整張臉被粉碎了的屍體，一種是側面被粉碎了的屍體。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那时，现场出现了两种尸体。一种是整张脸被粉碎了的尸体，一种是侧面被粉碎了的尸体。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "In quel momento, c'erano due tipi di cadaveri. C'erano quelli con i loro volti completamente distrutti, e quelli con solo metà delle loro facce polverizzate."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "That's right. The ones with their faces smashed were Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa, and Gohda. The ones with the sides of their heads smashed were Krauss and Shannon.
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right. Four with their faces smashed—Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa, and Gohda. Two with the sides of their heads smashed—Krauss and Shannon."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだ。顔面粉砕は、留弗夫、霧江、楼座、郷田の４人。側頭部粉砕は、蔵臼、紗音の２人だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだ。顔面粉砕は、留弗夫、霧江、楼座、郷田の４人。側頭部粉砕は、蔵臼、紗音の２人だった」
Russian (RU): "Да. Те, кому изуродовали всё лицо, были Рудольф, Кирие, Роза и Года. Пол‐лица же изуродовали Крауссу с Шаннон."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo. Quatro com os rostos esmagados — Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa e Gohda. Dois com um lado da cabeça esmagado — Krauss e Shannon."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的。面部粉碎的是，留弗夫、霧江、樓座、鄉田四人。側頭部粉碎的是，藏臼、紗音兩人。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是的。面部粉碎的是，留弗夫、雾江、楼座、乡田四人。侧头部粉碎的是，藏臼、纱音两人。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Esatto. Quelle con le loro facce distrutte erano Rudolf, Kyrie, Rosa, e Gohda. Quelli con parte della loro testa distrutta erano Krauss e Shannon.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): ...At the time, I fickly created two types of corpses, but I realized that the former, more atrocious type was actually disadvantageous for me."
Umineko Project (UP): "......At the time, I had fickly created two types of corpses, but I realized that the former, more atrocious type was actually disadvantageous for me."
PC Japanese (JP): ……妾も、あの時点では気まぐれに生み出した２種類の死体であったが、より残忍な死体である前者の方が、妾にとってむしろ不利であることに気付いたのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……妾も、あの時点では気まぐれに生み出した２種類の死体であったが、より残忍な死体である前者の方が、妾にとってむしろ不利であることに気付いたのだ」
Russian (RU): "......В тот раз я легкомысленно создала два типа трупов, но затем осознала, что первый тип был для меня опасен."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Naquele momento, eu caprichosamente criei dois tipos de cadáveres, mas percebi que esse método, mais atroz, era desvantajoso para mim."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……雖然妾身在那時一時隨性，創造出了兩種屍體，但妾身現已意識到了，更為殘忍的前一種屍體，對妾身來說反而不利。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……虽然妾身在那时一时随性，创造出了两种尸体，但妾身现已意识到了，更为残忍的前一种尸体，对妾身来说反而不利。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Al tempo, avevo incostantemente creato due tipi di corpi, ma realizzai che il primo tipo, il più atroce, era in realtà svantaggioso per me."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Disadvantageous for you...? ......I see. So that's what this is."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Disadvantageous for you......? ............Right. I get it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ベアトにとって不利……？…………そうか。そういうことか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ベアトにとって不利……？　…………そうか。そういうことか」
Russian (RU): "......Опасен для тебя, Беато? .........Ясно. Понял."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Desvantajoso para você......? ............Sim. Entendi."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……對貝阿朵不利……？…………是嘛。是這麼一回事嘛。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……对贝阿朵不利……？…………是嘛。是这么一回事嘛。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Svantaggioso per te, Beato...? ... Giusto. Ho capito."

Steam (ST): That's right. The smashed faces might look atrocious. ...But that made it hard to confirm the identity of each person.
Umineko Project (UP): That's right. The smashed faces might look atrocious.{n}......But they made it hard to confirm the identity of the person.
PC Japanese (JP): そうなんだ。一見残酷な顔面粉砕。……しかしそれは、本人確認を難しくしているのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そうなんだ。一見残酷な顔面粉砕。{n}……しかしそれは、本人確認を難しくしているのだ。
Russian (RU): Так и есть. Изуродованные лица могут вызывать гамму самых разных отрицательных чувств.{n}......Но они же и затрудняют опознание личности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso mesmo. Os rostos esmagados podem parecer atrozes.{n}......Mas só fazem com que seja mais difícil confirmar a identidade da pessoa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對。初看之下，面部粉碎非常殘酷。{n}……但是，這種做法會使屍體難以確認是不是本人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对。初看之下，面部粉碎非常残酷。{n}……但是，这种做法会使尸体难以确认是不是本人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È vero. I volti distrutti possono sembrare atroci. ... Ma rendono difficile confermare l'identità della persona.

Steam (ST): For example, at that time, Uncle Krauss and Shannon-chan had their heads half smashed.
Umineko Project (UP): For example, at that time, Uncle Krauss and Shannon‐chan had had their heads only half‐smashed.
PC Japanese (JP): 例えば、あの時の蔵臼伯父さんと紗音ちゃんは、頭部は半壊だった。
Russian (RU): К примеру, в тот раз половину лица изуродовали дяде Крауссу и Шаннон‐чан.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por exemplo, naquela ocasião, o tio Krauss e a Shannon‐chan tiveram suas cabeças parcialmente esmagadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 比如說，那時的藏臼伯父與紗音頭部半毀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 比如说，那时的藏臼伯父与纱音头部半毁。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per esempio, al tempo, Krauss oji-san e Shannon-chan avevano le loro teste mezze distrutte.

Steam (ST): That alone was atrocious enough, but because half of their faces remained, it was easy to confirm their identities.
Umineko Project (UP): That itself was of course atrocious, but because half of their faces remained, it was easy to confirm their identity.
PC Japanese (JP): それ自体も、もちろん残酷ではあるが、顔が半分残っていたため、容易に本人確認が出来た。
Russian (RU): Зрелище, конечно, душераздирающее, но оставшаяся половина лица позволила с легкостью опознать их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso por si só já é algo desumano, mas como parte de suas faces permaneceram, foi fácil confirmar suas identidades.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這本身當然也非常殘酷，但由於留下了半張臉，所以能輕易確認為本人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这本身当然也非常残酷，但由于留下了半张脸，所以能轻易确认为本人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo era di per sé atroce ovviamente, ma dato che metà del loro volto era rimasto, fu facile confermare la loro identità.

Steam (ST): But Dad and the other three were different.
Umineko Project (UP): But Dad and the other three were different.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、親父たち４人は違った。
Russian (RU): А вот с папой и остальными — тут уже совсем другое дело.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Já meu pai e os outros três é um caso diferente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，老爸他們四個就不一樣了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，老爸他们四个就不一样了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma per Papà e gli altri era diverso.

Steam (ST): Because his face had been completely destroyed, even I, as his son, could only guess by inference that it had to be Dad because of his clothes and the like.
Umineko Project (UP): Because his face had been completely destroyed, even I, his son, could only guess that it had to have been Dad because of his clothes and the like.
PC Japanese (JP): 顔面が全壊だったため、実の息子の俺でさえ、服装などから親父に違いないと類推するしかなかった。
Russian (RU): Поскольку его лицо было полностью уничтожено, то даже я, его собственный сын, мог догадываться, что передо мной находится его тело, по его одежде и тому подобным деталям.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como seus rostos foram completamente destruídos, mesmo eu, seu filho, só fui capaz de reconhecer ele por causa de suas roupas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於面部全毀，所以就連親生兒子的我，都只能根據服裝等方面，將之推測為老爸。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于面部全毁，所以就连亲生儿子的我，都只能根据服装等方面，将之推测为老爸。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che la sua faccia era completamente distrutta, persino io, suo figlio, potevo solo supporre per deduzione che doveva essere Papà per via dei suoi vestiti e dell'apparenza.

Steam (ST): ...In short, it remained vague until the end whether that really had been Dad's corpse.
Umineko Project (UP): ......In short, it remained unclear until the end whether that really was Dad's corpse.
PC Japanese (JP): ……つまり、本当にあれが親父の死体だったのか、ついにはうやむやのままだったわけだ。
Russian (RU): ......Короче, до конца оставалось толком не ясным факт, был ли это действительно труп отца или нет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Resumindo, permaneceu incerto até o fim se era mesmo o corpo do meu pai.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……也就是說，那是否真的是老爸的屍體，這點自始至終都含糊不清。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……也就是说，那是否真的是老爸的尸体，这点自始至终都含糊不清。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... In breve, è rimasto vago fino alla fine se quello fosse davvero il cadavere di Papà.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "If this reasoning battle had taken place during the first game as well, I would probably have claimed that, since the identities of Dad and the rests' bodies were impossible to confirm, there was a possibility that one was a fake corpse. ...After all, Beato didn't state anything in red during that game."
Umineko Project (UP): "If this reasoning battle had taken place during the first game as well, I would probably have claimed that, since it was impossible to confirm that those corpses were indeed Dad and the others, there was a possibility that one was a fake corpse. ......After all, Beato didn't state anything in red during that game whatsoever."
PC Japanese (JP): 「第一のゲームの時にも、もしも推理バトルが行なわれてたなら、俺は多分、親父たちの死体を、本人確認不能のため、偽装死体の可能性もあると主張していたかもしれない。……何しろ、あのゲームの時にはベアトは一切、赤での発言もしていない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「第一のゲームの時にも、もしも推理バトルが行なわれてたなら、俺は多分、親父たちの死体を、本人確認不能のため、偽装死体の可能性もあると主張していたかもしれない。……何しろ、あのゲームの時にはベアトは一切、赤での発言もしていない」

Dopotutto, Beato non aveva affermato niente in rosso durante quel gioco."

Speaker: Gaap
Steam (ST): "Well done. Correct. ......A faked death is one of the basics of the mystery genre. Even if you make a doctor examine the corpse, you can't trust the results if you suspect him of being the culprit's accomplice. Therefore, corpses that can't guarantee a death for certain are always disadvantageous for the witch's side."
Umineko Project (UP): "Well done. Correct. .........A faked death is one of the basics of the mystery genre. Even if you make a doctor examine the corpse, you can't trust the results if you suspect him of being in league with the culprit. So, corpses that can't guarantee a death for certain always put the witch side at a disadvantage."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お上手よ。それで正解。………偽装死はミステリーの基本の一つ。たとえ医者に検死をさせたとしても、犯人とグルを疑われればその結果は信用できない。つまり、確実な死を保証できない死体は常に、魔女サイドを不利にするということ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お上手よ。それで正解。………偽装死はミステリーの基本の一つ。たとえ医者に検死をさせたとしても、犯人とグルを疑われればその結果は信用できない。つまり、確実な死を保証できない死体は常に、魔女サイドを不利にするということ」
Russian (RU): "Очень хорошо. Молодец. .........Сфабрикованная смерть — одна из основ детективного жанра. Даже если доктор обследует труп, ты не можешь доверять результатам, если подозреваешь его в сговоре с преступником. Таким образом, трупы, чью смерть нельзя стопроцентно подтвердить, становятся опасными для ведьмы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Muito bem. Está correto. .........E uma morte falsa é uma parte básica do gênero de mistério. Mesmo se pedir para um médico examinar o corpo, você não pode confiar nos resultados se você suspeita que ele é cúmplice do culpado. Por isso, cadáveres que não podem ter suas mortes confirmadas com absoluta certeza colocam o lado da bruxa em desvantagem."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「漂亮。這就是正解哦。………偽裝死是推理劇的基本之一。就算有醫生驗過屍，也是只要懷疑到醫生是犯人一伙的可能性，驗屍結果就不可信了。也就是說，無法保證確實死亡的屍體，永遠都會對魔女方不利。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「漂亮。这就是正解哦。………伪装死是推理剧的基本之一。就算有医生验过尸，也是只要怀疑到医生是犯人一伙的可能性，验尸结果就不可信了。也就是说，无法保证确实死亡的尸体，永远都会对魔女方不利。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ben fatto. Corretto. ... Una falsa morte è una delle basi del genere del mistero. Anche se fai in modo che un dottore faccia una autopsia, non puoi fidarti del risultato se sospetti che lui sia un complice del colpevole. Pertanto, cadaveri che non possono assicurare per certo una morte sono sempre svantaggiosi per lo schieramento della strega."
